For Great Victory, Great Villains!

Sometimes, you just need stuff to beat up. Here, in the Villain Gazette, we provide a villain, their minions, and some cool gear for both sides to use. In this issue:

Gabrar Starblade: The Kin-Eater!
Gabrar's minions, the Roving Hunger!
Stats for an assortment of Vibrational Blades, and their accessories!




See the villain's stats, learn their secrets, and prepare to deploy them on PCs in need of conflict. Includes the Redeemability Scale rating of the villain (so you know if they can be salvaged), and Adventure Seeds for bringing the villain into YOUR campaigns!

144105.name: Punaiset hiekat - Somalia roolipeleissä
144105.description:
From the back of the book (translated from Finnish):

"The sand is so hot that it burns the skin to blisters. Camels continue their way and their hoofs raise a red dust cloud. With the animals travel the somali. All their belongings are carried on the camels. Inhabitants of the poor land travel poor, but proud. They have no other ruler than God.

With this book you can transfer your roleplaying adventures to the red sands of Somalia. Whether your heroes are somalis of the past or present, pirate hunters on dangerous waters or giantslayers in a fantasy world, this book offers sources about Somalia and the somali people from the roleplaying perspective. The book can be used alongside most roleplaying games."

Actual text in Finnish:
"Hiekka on niin kuumaa, että se polttaa ihon rikki. Kamelit jatkavat kulkuaan ja niiden sorkista nousee punainen tomu. Eläinten mukana vaeltavat somalit. Heidän omaisuutensa mahtuu kamelikyytiin. Köyhän maan asukkaat kulkevat köyhinä, mutta ylpeinä. Heillä ei ole muuta valtiasta kuin Jumala.

Tämän teoksen avulla voit siirtää roolipeliseikkalusi Somalian punaisille hiekoille. Olivatpa sankarinne sitten menneiden tai nykyisten aikojen somaleita, merirosvojen torjujia vaarallisilla vesillä tai jättiläisensurmaajia fantasiamaailmassa, tämä kirja tarjoaa aineistoa Somaliasta ja somaleista roolipelaamisen näkökulmasta. Teosta voi käyttää useimpien roolipelien apuvälineenä."

144106.name: Stupid Zombies 2
144106.description:
Description
Over 18 million players have already enjoyed Stupid Zombies, but what is a good zombie story without a sequel?

The undead return in this new, jam-packed release with exciting, brainless creatures, weapons, puzzles, moody environments all wrapped up in a slick, user-friendly package.

Features:

Funtastic gameplay, now even better!
500 levels.
Choose between a male and female hero character.
Game Center leader boards (iOS).
Universal app, enjoy it on your favorite iOS device.




Source: The Publisher Website.

144107.name: Barbarians of Lemuria: Grundregelwerk
144107.description:
From publisher blurb:

Entdecke Lemuria!

Eine halbe Million Jahre nach unserer Zeit ist das Antlitz der Erde nicht mehr wiederzuerkennen. Hier in Lemuria schreiben Helden ihre Sagas und Legenden mit Schwertern und Zauberei. Kämpfe als todesmutiger Barbar, lasterhafte Adelige, katzengleiche Diebin, skrupelloser Zauberer, ruchlose Priesterin oder gieriger Pirat um diese faszinierende und exotische Welt. Deine Waffen sind Stahl, arkane Kräfte und ein unbeugsamer Wille. Deine Gegner sind menschenverschlingende Urzeitdrachen, Druiden der Finsternis und abscheuliche Zaubererkönige, die niemals das Antlitz Lemurias hätten erblicken dürfen. Der Lohn all der Gefahren? Wein, Weib und Gesang, unermessliche Reichtümer, halbe und ganze Königreiche – aber vor allem Abenteuer, Abenteuer und Abenteuer. Bist Du bereit für Deine eigene Legende?

Das Rollenspiel Barbarians of Lemuria enthält alle Regeln, die zum Spielen einer Heldengeschichte nötig sind. Sie dienen dazu, das spielerische Erzählen einer Geschichte zu ermöglichen, und weniger dazu, das taktische Kriegssimulationsspiel mit all den dafür notwendigen Details und Verwaltungsaufgaben, die diese Art von Rollenspielen meist mit sich bringt, zu unterstützen. Es geht um außergewöhnliche heldenhafte Aktionen – nicht um langweilige und unwichtige Details.

Barbarians of Lemuria ist schnell und heroisch – voller aktionsgeladener Taten, Magie und Schwertkämpfe.


Translation courtesy of Google:

Discover Lemuria!

Half a million years after our time is the face of the earth no longer recognizable. Here in Lemuria write their sagas and legends heroes with swords and sorcery. Fight as fearless barbarian, depraved aristocrats, cat-like thief, unscrupulous wizards, priestess or greedy ruthless pirate to this fascinating and exotic world. Your weapons are steel, arcane forces and an indomitable will. Your opponents are menschenverschlingende primeval dragon, druid of darkness and vile sorcerer kings who never had been permitted to behold the face of Lemuria. The wages of all the risks? Wine, women and song, fabulous riches, half and whole kingdoms - especially adventure, adventure and adventure. Are you ready for your own legend?

The Barbarians of Lemuria RPG contains all the rules that are necessary for playing a heroic story. They are used to allow the playful telling a story, and less likely to support the tactical war simulation game with all the necessary details and administrative duties, which usually brings this kind of role play with them. It the extraordinary heroic actions - not boring and unimportant details.

Barbarians of Lemuria is quick and heroic - full of action-packed exploits, magic and sword fights.

144108.name: NooPolitik
144108.description:
NooPolitik is a non-collectable table- top card game designed by Ben Drain and published through the print-on-demand site thegamecrafter.com .
Players take on the role of one of 12 countries attempting to make a mark on history. As such, the theme of the game is historical and political. Players interact with each other through the spheres of political, military, clandestine, and economic pools of resources, using 3 different bidding systems. When a player accomplishes a feat such as bringing a new achievement into the world, or expunging someone else’s, they score a card towards victory, playing to 21 points.
The game contains 12 unique country cards, 96 unique action cards, 104 unique achievements, 18 multicolored non-standard dice, and a large collection of resource tokens representing the resources of the game (labor, steel, plastics, unrest, etc), and 50 glass beads used for bidding.

144109.name: The Will of the Diseased
144109.description:
User summary

This is a WFRP 3 scenario for characters in their 1st rank. It is intentionally short, allowing for convention play within a restricted time slot, but it is flexible enough to incorporate into larger campaigns as a minor sidequest.

The scenario rotates around sickness, suffering and Nurgle's joy of spreading diseases. It is set in the small town of Bröckel (on the travel and trading route between Altdorf and Middenheim) and the nearby forest, but it can easily be relocated to almost any other place. The town has a small,
bedraggled Shallyan hospice, but sits on a trade route and is hosting an annual feast for the merchants who are vital for Bröckel's (rather modest) prosperity.

An ill noble, Ferdinand von Ziegelstein, asks the PCs to bring an old friend who's a physician. Searching for him, the PCs discover he has been assaulted and kidnapped by orcs. While they are looking for him, disease is starting to spread.

The Will of the Diseased was created for the WFRP3 scenario contest 2012, organized by Jay Hafner.

144110.name: Oneupmanship: Mine's Bigger
144110.description: "Show me a good loser, and I'll show you a real loser." Oneupmanship is a satirical board game where the players struggle for money, power, and ego. The winner is the first player to earn $100,000 through any means possible: playing the stock market, building skyscrapers, gambling, or collecting trophies.

144111.name: Samurai vs Zombies Defense 2
144111.description:
The Samurai is back... and he’s brought friends! Play as the heroic Samurai, the deadly Kunoichi Assassin, and the stalwart Armored Ronin to defend your village against even nastier hordes of brutal zombies and demons! Recruit allies, build defenses, and recover sacred Artifacts to stop them!

FEATURES

Recruit exciting new allies and set up your defense against hordes of zombies!
Expand your defense by unlocking powerful new heroes!
Steal Artifacts from your friends (or enemies!) to complete collections and gain big rewards!
Become more powerful by acquiring better weapons, defenses, and magical abilities!




Source: The Publisher Website.

144112.name: Magus
144112.description:
User Summary

The story follows a character named Magus who in a world of water and fire was imprisoned and tortured in the Waterfall Kingdom for unknown reasons. After many years he manages to escape with the help of a new prisoner named Kinna. Together they go on a quest to battle the forces that imprisoned Magus and prevent him from becoming the god he was meant to be.

The combat is a color-based spell-casting mechanic where Magus must absorb color from the environment and use red, green, and purple magic to vanquish his foes. Players can specialize in one color or many and spell types will range from tornadoes to shape-shifting.

144113.name: Logical Spies
144113.description:
You are a cunning and dastardly spy. Deny it, you scoundrel! Use your skills of wit and observation to discover the other spies’ identities and expose them before they expose you. The winner is the last remaining spy.

Logical Spies unfolds like a social logic puzzle, in which the players play the role of a spy. Your identity is represented by 6 cards: Nationality, Codename, Cover, Vulnerability, Secret Weapon, and special Agent ability.

Each round begins with the Spying phase and ends with the Accusations phase. Spying is fast and simultaneous. Recover your cards as quickly as you can while observing what other players do. Accusations is calculating and methodical. Consult your Logic Sheet. Accuse other players until you make a false accusation. As you make correct accusations, players must reveal that card.
When your entire identity is revealed, you are out of the game.

The 12 Agent cards add a special ability. The Enigma may lie about his Codename. The Assassin may wink at players to make them reveal a card. The Die Hard gets 1 final round of accusations upon elimination...

144114.name: Overkill 2
144114.description:
The proud sequel to the hit shooter Overkill!

Overkill 2 is a gun centric shooter that follows in the success of the original Overkill.
We've taken the original gameplay and took it to a whole new level with 3D features, new game mechanics and 3D weapons. No more enemies sliding onto the screen. Overkill 2 features fully animated 3D enemies that will show no mercy.

BREATH-TAKING GUN UPGRADING!
This is hard to describe with words. Once you get the chance to tap on the amazing 3D weapon models and toy with them, you will know what we mean. There are already over 30 beautifully rendered weapons and there will be more!

NEW GAME MECHANICS
Our fans and players of Overkill have always asked for health and armor upgrades. At Craneballs we listen and we deliver. Introducing combat equipment and armor and health boosting tactical items.

NEW UNITS
Of course all units in Overkill 2 are new. Strictly speaking though, we've introduced a completely new type of unit. Be ready to face the grenadiers! You are no longer the only one who can throw stun and flash grenades. Plus there are also the high explosive grenades falling on your head. Grenades can be shot midair, which adds yet another challenge to test how quick your reflexes truly are.

THE GRAPHICS
Gameplay is always the key component to any successful game. We know that very well. But we also know that when you add graphics that are pleasure to look at, you improve the gameplay experience by thousands. Which is exactly what we did. Attention to the very last detail is what makes our games different. Check the screens for yourselves!

Source: The Developer Website.

144115.name: Angvik
144115.description:
Angvik is a platform action game set in a joyful but unforgiving land. Take up your father’s gear and save a castle from a barbarian with the assistance of many items and birds!

Source: The Game Website.

144116.name: The Trellborg Monstrosities (CoC)
144116.description:
From the back of the book:

TERROR IN THE ARCTIC CIRCLE!

Achtung! Cthulhu brings you a two-fisted wartime roleplaying game setting packed full of fiendish Nazis, terrifying ancient mysteries, legendary war machines, and enough writhing tentacles to fill ten Reichstags!

The Trellborg Monstrosities is a standalone adventure for both hardened Call of Cthulhu (2nd - 6th Edition) veterans and newcomers alike and is set in 1943 as the tide of war is finally turning against the Nazi war machine. It is the first of our new standalone 'Adventure Series' for Achtung! Cthulhu that will be released as a compilation in Spring 2014.

Join a band of heroic investigators, including resistance partisans and British special forces, as they plunge deep behind enemy lines on the frozen Norwegian- Finnish border to confront an ancient horror and a terrifying artefact which could alter the course of the war. Based on The Trellborg Monstrosities, the horrifying novella by John Houlihan—also available from Modiphius Entertainment!

Inside you will find everything that you need for hours of gripping roleplaying adventure including:

- A standalone multi-part adventure for hours of spine-chilling play.

- Detailed maps of the frozen border of Norway and Finland, the village of Trellborg, and an abandoned Nazi camp with separate handout files.

- Four pre-generated investigator characters to get you straight into the action.

- Rules for new skills, spells and equipment.

- Includes the 65 Page Novella 'The Monstrosities at Trellborg' by John Houlihan

Requires the Call of Cthulhu (6th Edition) rulebook to play.

144117.name: The Trellborg Monstrosities (Savage Worlds)
144117.description:
From the back of the book:

TERROR IN THE ARCTIC CIRCLE!

Achtung! Cthulhu brings you a two-fisted wartime roleplaying game setting packed full of fiendish Nazis, terrifying ancient mysteries, legendary war machines, and enough writhing tentacles to fill ten Reichstags!

The Trellborg Monstrosities is a standalone adventure for both hardened Savage Worlds veterans and newcomers alike and is set in 1943 as the tide of war is finally turning against the Nazi war machine. It is the first of our new standalone 'Adventure Series' for Achtung! Cthulhu that will be released as a compilation in Spring 2014.

Join a band of heroic investigators, including resistance partisans and British special forces, as they plunge deep behind enemy lines on the frozen Norwegian- Finnish border to confront an ancient horror and a terrifying artefact which could alter the course of the war. Based on The Trellborg Monstrosities, the horrifying novella by John Houlihan—also available from Modiphius Entertainment!

Inside you will find everything that you need for hours of gripping roleplaying adventure including:

- A standalone multi-part adventure for hours of spine-chilling play.

- Detailed maps of the frozen border of Norway and Finland, the village of Trellborg, and an abandoned Nazi camp with separate handout files.

- Four pre-generated investigator characters to get you straight into the action.

- Rules for new skills, spells and equipment.

- Includes the 65 Page Novella 'The Monstrosities at Trellborg' by John Houlihan

Requires the Savage Worlds rulebook to play.

144118.name: Seelenfänger: Ultralight GRT
144118.description:
From the homepage
Das Ultralight Kurzregelwerk wurde für das Seelenfänger Rollenspiel entwickelt. Mit der aktuellen Sonderedition für den Gratisrollenspieltag "Ultralight GRT" erhaltet Ihr universell einsetzbare Kurzregeln für jede Art des P&PRollenspiels, optimiert für das Fantasy-Genre. Dieses einfache, schnelle Regelkonstrukt ist speziell für Oneshots (kurze Abenteuer) und zur Nutzung auf Cons konzipiert.

UltralightGRT ermöglicht es dem Spieler, durch Einbringen deskriptiver Elemente, also Beschreibungen, die Erfolgs-Chancen seiner Bemühungen zu erhöhen und so einen starken Einfluss auf das Spiel auszuüben. Dieses Kurzregelwerk ermöglicht es euch, mit minimalem Aufwand, ohne langes Regelstudieren, spannende Abenteuer in der Welt von Seelenfänger, oder auch jeder anderen Spielwelt, zu erleben.

Die einfachen Regeln nutzen ein W6-Poolsystem und unterstützen ein freies, kreatives, cineastisches und heldiges Rollenspiel.

English Translation
The Ultralight quickstart/ short rules was developed for the Seelenfänger RPG. With the current special edition "Ultralight GRT" for the Gratisrollenspieltag 2013 (GRT), you have universal rules for each type of pen&paper rpg, optimized for the fantasy genre. This simple, fast rules system is designed for oneshots and convention games.

UltralightGRT allows the player to increase his chance of success by introducing descriptive elements into the game, and thus to exert a strong influence on the game. This short set of rules allows you to play with minimal effort, without much studying of the rules, to experience exciting adventures in the world of Seelenfänger, or any other game setting.

The simple rules use a d6 pool system and support free, creative, cinematic and heroic roleplaying.

Ultralight GRT is released under a Creative Commons license.

144119.name: Plants Vs Zombies: Garden Warfare
144119.description:
Plants vs. Zombies is digging into the trenches with an explosive new action experience. Blast zombies, plants and new characters across a mine-blowing PvZ world. Take on Co-op and Multiplayer action with your friends and sow the seeds of victory!

Source: The Publisher Website.

144121.name: Final Fantasy XV
videogamehonor: 2015 Gamescom Best Playstation Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Gamescom Best Role Playing Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Gamescom Best Xbox Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Japan Game Awards Best Unreleased Game Winner
2016 Game Critics Best Role Playing Game of the Year Winner
2016 Gamescom Best Playstation Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Gamescom Best Role Playing Game of the Year Winner
2016 Japan Game Awards Best Unreleased Game Winner
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Design of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Gameplay of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Heroine of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Multiplatform Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Winner
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Hottest Gal of the Year Winner
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Hottest Guy of the Year Winner
144121.description:
"Final Fantasy XV (ファイナルファンタジーXV Fainaru Fantajī Fifutīn) is an upcoming action role-playing video game that will be published by Square Enix for PlayStation 4 and Xbox One. Its concept is a heavy departure from other installments in the Final Fantasy series, providing a darker and more realistic atmosphere that focuses on human emotions and believable characters. The game features expansive environments and a seamless and customizable battle system, which gives players great freedom regarding their preferred play method.

The story is based on the Fabula Nova Crystallis mythology, but has no direct relation to the other games in this series as it features a unique world, visual design and different characters. Its main protagonist, Noctis, is the prince of a mafia-like royal family which protects the last remaining crystal in the world and rules over a technologically advanced city-state. The plot centers on the invasion of a medieval war nation that tries to conquer the crystal. During the course of the game, Noctis meets the aristocratic and kind Stella who shares his ability of seeing a mysterious 'light' connected to a goddess of the dead.

Final Fantasy XV started production shortly before its announcement in May 2006, when it was initially unveiled under the title Final Fantasy Versus XIII (ヴェルサスXIII Verusasu Sātīn) alongside Final Fantasy XIII and Final Fantasy Agito XIII (which was later renamed to Final Fantasy Type-0). The game's long development time and absence from the public eye gave rise to several rumors concerning its possible cancellation or shift to another platform. In June 2013, it was eventually revealed to have been renamed and switched systems from PlayStation 3 to PlayStation 4 and Xbox One. Final Fantasy XV is being developed by a team within Square Enix's 1st Production Department and directed by Tetsuya Nomura, who also designed the characters and conceived the concept and base story.

Final Fantasy XV is an action role-playing game with third-person shooter elements. The player character is seen from a third-person perspective that will be adjusted depending on the weapon currently equipped. The game's environments among others include kingdoms and villages and allow for much freedom and interactivity: for example, objects can be destroyed and different paths may be chosen to reach a destination. The world map is a wide, open field that the player can traverse on foot or by using a car, an airship or a chocobo. A day-and-night time system affects the appearance of monsters on the world map. Final Fantasy XV uses interactive cutscenes in the form of real-time events. The player keeps control during them as the gameplay is not interrupted, which will result in natural progressions and storytelling that is similar to that of first-person shooters. However, the game also features uncontrollable pre-rendered full motion videos (FMVs) for scenes in which player control would have little effect. The ratio of real-time event scenes and pre-rendered FMVs is 7:3."

Source: Wikipedia, "Final Fantasy XV", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

144122.name: Saratoga 1777 AD
144122.description:
(From the publisher's web site) Of all the battles in the American Revolution, Saratoga was the one that really gave the Patriots a belief that they could win—and convinced the outside world (starting with France) that the rebels were worth supporting. Take away the victory at Saratoga, and we can only wonder how much more time would have passed before the French alliance happened…if ever.

Now you can explore the two main battles of Saratoga, both Freeman’s Farm and Bemis Heights, as a growing storm of colonial militia and regulars, commanded by Gates but really led by Arnold, turned “Gentleman Johnny’s” adventure into a disaster.

Rob Markham’s design gives life to the combatants, as players wrestle with command-control, fog-of-war, and troop quality ratings that mean a larger force may actually be weaker.
The Battle of Saratoga contains:
One 11” by 17” mounted map sheet
One set of 200 die cut mounted counters
One 8 page rulebook
Two Six-Sided Dice

144124.name: Trilogy of Games
144124.description:
User Summary

Three games by Bill Budge:

Night Driver – Drive around a track twice as fast as you can without crashing.

Pinball – Play old school pinball. 3 balls per play.

Space War – 2 player dogfight it out around a star. Don't get to close to the star or risk being destroyed by gravitational forces.

144125.name: Mirror's Edge: Catalyst
videogamedeveloper: EA Digital Illusions CE AB (EA DICE)
videogamehonor: 2016 Golden Joystick Best Gaming Moment Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Best Visual Design of the Year Nominee
144125.description:
It is the upcoming prequel to Mirror's Edge and will revolve around Faith's past.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mirror's Edge (2016 video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

144126.name: Phineas and Ferb: Quest for Cool Stuff
144126.description:
There’s a whole lot of stuff to do in the last week of summer vacation and Phineas and Ferb want to do it all! Join these charismatic brothers of invention as they create, travel and explore in their quest to find hidden treasure to fill out the Museum of Cool. Perry the pet platypus, aka Agent P, has their backs when bumbling villain Dr. Doofenshmirtz unleashes his latest obscure “-inator” devices designed to take over the entire Tri-State area!
GAME FEATURES

Play as Phineas, Ferb and Perry/Agent P and interact with fan-favorite characters from the show including Dr. Doofenshmirtz, Candace, Isabella, Buford and Baljeet.

Source: The Game Website.

144127.name: Laser Bounce
144127.description:
User Summary

Bounce your laser off of over flying ships to kill your opponents people. The game ends when one side has no more people.

144128.name: The Singularity System
144128.description:
From the back cover:
THE STARS BELONG TO YOU
Inside the Singularity System, you will find:

A complete, original tabletop roleplaying game that can be used with any science fiction setting
Rules for personal combat, tactical vehicular combat, mech piloting, and even strategic starship battles
Skills, traits, weapons, armor, vehicles, and starships to help enhance your science fiction universe




The Singularity System
A science fiction roleplaying system for any universe

144129.name: Dragon (Issue 424 - Jun 2013)
rpgissuearticle: Eye on the Realms: The Dragon that Never Died
History Check: Martek and the Desert of Desolation
144129.description:
Contents:

3 Editiorial: Thinking Dragons by Steve Winter
When you look at a dragon, you instantly see its size and power. What you don't see but should be equally frightened of is its dark, inscrutable intelligence.

4 Catastrophic Dragons by Bruce Cordell and Ari Marmell
Only the most seasoned adventurers know about catastrophic dragons—and to know these creatures is to fear them. Meet the avalanche dragon and the typhoon dragon.

14 Martek and the Desert of Desolation by Sterling Hershey
Ages ago, the wizard Martek bested and banished a mighty efreeti in a magical duel. To prevent its eventual escape, Martek set events into motion and awaited heroes who would be equal to his challenge.

20 Achievements by Robert J. Schwalb
Gold, magic items, jewels, and power are the traditional motivators that drive adventurers. A few seek medals, titles, and fame. This article explores a third category that we call achievements: connections, influence, information, and property.

34 The Dragon that Never Died by Ed Greenwood
The green dragon Aglaraerose sleeps atop the greatest treasure ever assembled in Faerûn—or so they say. Though thousands of treasure seekers have entered the dragon’s mountain, only one ever emerged, and he told a tale that could hardly be believed.

144130.name: Magus (Issue 41 - Mar 1999)
rpgissuearticle: Review: Mordheim: The City of Damned
144130.description:
The Magus magazine has gone through some big changes as the editor-in-chief has changed.

ISSN 0788-3951

144131.name: Viking Funeral
144131.description:
Available for free on the IronWall Games website.

Viking Funeral makes use of decks of standard playing cards that would otherwise be disposed of. Like "Risk: Legacy" by the same designer, permanent changes are made to the cards throughout the course of play, and these changes will persist into future plays of the game using the same set of cards.

This game is played with a 52-card deck (French-suited) that you supply yourself, and a marker or pen to write on the cards, and optionally, a pair of scissors or matches or something to destroy cards with, and if available, a trash can to serve as "Valhalla".

A single card is drawn randomly at the start of a game and destroyed, but not to the point of its number and suit being unrecognizable. This becomes the "recently deceased".

Players start with a hand of cards, with the lead player playing a single card to the center of the table ("the funeral") that are either in agreement (same suit color) or start a fight (differing suit colors).

Tricks are won by playing the high card when in agreement, or by winning fights (being form the same family as the recently deceased provides a bonus in a fight). The winner takes the trick and puts the cards into that player's victory point pile ("mead hall"). Cards are drawn by the player who did not win cards for their mead hall from the deck ("the village").

Throughout play, players are encouraged to either sing the praises of the "recently deceased" or trash-talk the card, treating each suit as it were an viking family line. The game ends when no more cards are left in the village to replenish players' hands, and the game is won by the player with the most cards in their mead hall, with a tie breaker going to the player whose mead hall cards have the most wounds (as indicated by marks made to cards during play).

In true viking fashion, the game strongly emphasis that there are no ties, either during play or in calculating victory.

144132.name: Kings and Legends
144132.description:
User Summary

Kings and Legends is an addictive and enjoyable massively multiplayer online browser collectible trading card game which combines the strategic gameplay experience of trading card games and social game experience of MMOG.

Carrying an immersive storyline, the game takes you through a series of battles, quests and Arena showdowns against other players. The experience gained guides you to higher levels, where new, more challenging opponents await you. You can also equip your hero, form Guild alliances with others and even gather resources while offline.

Effective deck-building is crucial. You can gradually have access to hundreds of creature or magic cards, each with their own unique artwork. Combine them skilfully to create a variety of decks to your personal liking or specifically suited to tactically overcome any scenario.

144133.name: N.O.V.A. 3 - Near Orbit Vanguard Alliance
144133.description:
Near Orbit Vanguard Alliance 3 (also called N.O.V.A. 3) is Gameloft's third installment of the critically acclaimed N.O.V.A. series for iOS and Android devices, with planned releases for the BlackBerry PlayBook and Windows Phone 8 devices. The game was released on the App Store on May 10, 2012. N.O.V.A. 3 falls into the sci-fi action-adventure FPS genre.
As with many of the action-adventure titles released by Gameloft, N.O.V.A 3 features Gameloft's multiplayer service Gameloft Live.

Source: Wikipedia, "N.O.V.A. 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

144134.name: Renaissance Heroes
144134.description:
User Summary

Renaissance Heroes is a fast paced shooter massively multiplayer browser based game with a medieval twist. You can choose a hero and lead him through a series of showdowns with the purpose of battling through specially designed maps, capturing flags and, ultimately, retrieving Leonardo da Vinci's unfinished inventions.

Providing a first person shooter gameplay, coupled with item pick-ups and an array of extra goodies, Renaissance Heroes is bound to create a unique and intense experience.

144135.description:
Sparta versus Athens is a strategic level game of the Peloponnesian War in it's entirety, spanning twenty-eight years, from 431 B.C. to 404 B.C. The map is a point-to-point map, using city-states and the common land and navigable sea routes as the conduits that defined the Grecian Mediterranean. The game is designed for simple movement and combat mechanics to resolve battles and sieges, all centered upon the predominance of famous and historic leaders (e.g., Alcibiades). The game is richly historic, and keeps players within historic parameters in such a way that alliances and politics can shift, depending on how the war is going, but only within the limits of historic possibilities. Some city-states of the Delos Confederation may ally with Athens, while others may ally with Sparta, for example. Athens vs Sparta includes four scenarios: The Archidamian War (431 - 422), The Peace of Nicias and the Sicilian Expedition (421 – 413), The Ionian War (412 – 404), and the campaign scenario covering the entire war.

The game includes one 22x34" map of the Grecian Mediterranean, including Sicily and southern Italy, and as far east as the Persian empire, 280 counters of all participants in the Peloponnesian War. Each game turn is played as four seasons of one year. Each inch equals ~18 miles. One naval strength point represents 5 galleys of the era (Triremes), and one land strength point represents 350 to 450 heavy infantry (Hoplites) or 500 to 600 light infantry or 200 to 300 cavalry.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 280 counters.
144135.name: Sparta versus Athens

144136.name: Elysium-TCG
144136.description:
User Summary

Elysium-TCG is a digital trading card game that offers single player mode as well as online and local bluetooth play.

144137.name: Might & Magic: Duel of Champions
144137.description:
Might & Magic Duel of Champions is a free To play online card game set in the fantastic Might & Magic universe. Choose a hero and build his army with Unit, Spell and Fortune cards to defeat your opponents in epic card battles.

MMDoC is a Free To Play Trading Card Game!

Register and play for free in a completely new format within the immersive fantasy universe of Might & Magic.
Discover a wealth of beautifully illustrated game cards, featuring all the well-known characters, spells and heroes from the Might & Magic series of games.




Skill Based Gameplay

Develop your skills and combos whilst mastering the highly strategic gameplay, with resource management, deck building, trading etc.
Collect over 250 fantastically detailed cards ranging from unit, event, or hero to spell and fortune, each with their own special powers to help you win the game.




Become a Game Master

Deploy units, cast spells, and take advantage of fortunes and events in order to defeat your opponents’ hero.
Choose your hero to determine which spells you can use and which faction your army hails from. Each hero will determine your starting level and life, as well as access to a specific number of schools of magic.
Each player selects event cards which are shuffled together and drawn each turn, to provide a variety of benefits. Choose carefully however, as event cards can help your opponent too!
Build your army for battle, strengthening your deck and deploying your units across 16 positions on the battlefield as you prepare to take on your opponent.




Socialise and Compete Online

Engage in online tournaments and leaderboards, and post updates of your progress to Facebook and Twitter from within the game.
Access chats and forums directly within the game, and create guilds to socialise with your friends.




Enhance your Experience

Campaign and Multiplayer matches earn currency to use in the e-shop to build your deck and further your game experience.
Collect rewards including cards, decks, boosts, currency, and tournament tickets.




Cross Platform

Accessible online on PC and iPad!




Source: The Game Website. (edited)

144138.name: Cubemen2
144138.description:
WHAT IS CUBEMEN 2?
Cubemen 2 is a fast paced, action packed, original 3D Strategy game where you use your little Cubemen units to defend and attack enemies in a range of awesome game modes including CTF, Skirmish, Territory and more.

For the multi-player enthusiasts, you can compete in up to 6 player online Solo or Team battles against other humans or AI, for the top spot on the global rankings.

You can host your own online games or join other games in the easy to use game lobby, and all multi-player games support cross platform play.

For those that prefer the single-player experience, Cubemen 2 offers 2 unique single-player game modes plus a Campaign mode, all with online rankings so you can compete against the worlds best. Cubemen 2 offers enough variety to satisfy everyones strategy gaming needs.

CUSTOMIZE LEVEL & UNIT THEMES
Cubemen 2 offers some incredible looking level themes and unit skins to choose from. Personalise your units for single and multi-player games to stand out from the others.

You can also select specific level themes for the public levels you create so other players can see play your levels just the way you want them to.

BUILD IN LEVEL CREATION
Play on an almost endless supply of new and exciting user generated levels, or launch the easy to use built in level editor and make and share your own levels. All levels you create or download from the online gallery are stored locally so you can play your favourites when you are offline.

KEY GAME FEATURES

Five outstanding game modes including CTF, Territory and Rescue!
Customizable unit skins... Play as Cowboys, Knights or even Luchadores!
Built in Level Editor to play and share your own levels




Customizable level themes... Choose from over 20 styles

No static towers. Move your Cubemen around the level to attack or defend
Campaign mode where you compete against others for a global ranking
Up to 6 player cross-platform multi-player carnage
Find new online levels to play with a single click
Nine specialised unit types including path blockers, mines and lightning
Real 3D levels with Teleporters, Healing Stations and floating platforms
Online ranking for all game modes
Teams and individual multi-player games against Humans, AI or both!
Clean, rich and simplistic visuals that keep the focus on the strategy




Source: The Game Website.

144139.name: Cold Steel Reign Game Master's Screen
144139.description:
User summary

This is a set of two three-panel cardstock GM screens.

The first screen shows:

Weapons
Aiming Rules
Cover Bonuses
Standard Difficulty Mods
Untrained Weapons
Encumbered Characters
Punctured Wound Chart
Initiative Phase/Segment cost via action
Base to Hit numbers needed on a d12
Random Hit Locations
Animal Hit Locations
Hit Location Chart for Standard Fist Fights
Combat Botch Charts




The second screen shows:

NPC Demeanor
Random Languages Chart
NPC Main Stats
NPC Callings
Character Generation Steps
Faculties
Random Reaction Charts
Basic Casts
Disease List
Random Business Chart
Item Availability
Money Forms
Item Bane Chart
Travel Chart
Item Craftsmanship / Quality
Water Transport / Air Transport

144140.name: Fantasy Islands
144140.description:
A Fantasy Island-Building Game for 2 - 4 Tribal Leaders by Andreas Propst & Tobias Strunz.

“In the middle of a medieval fantasy archipelago, rival tribes are building their settlements on neighbouring islands. You are the clan-chief of one of these tribes and responsible for your village. Build and expand your settlement, care for your followers and nurture your clan. Finally you will be able to build a massive army or achieve cultural superiority. Whatever path to victory you choose - the fantasy islands await you!”

The goal of the game is to be the first player to collect 20 Victory Points. Each player starts with a tiny Starting Island made out of 7 hex tiles. Players will expand their islands in order to mine stone, ore and gather wood needed to build the more advanced buildings. Players will grow food and wine to keep their soldiers and wizards loyal and collect mana to cast powerful Spells.

In Fantasy Islands, many roads lead to victory: Pure Military force, Naval supremacy, securing the Trade monopoly, keeping your population happy, Cultural dominance or Spellcasting power. Excelling at one or more of these aspects will net you the VP needed to win and furthermore, players will be able to engage in Conflicts (Military, Trade, Sorcery, Cultural and Naval) which, in case they emerge victorious, will get them certain benefits.

This game is a cooperative effort by Andreas Propst (Austria) and Tobias Strunz (Germany).

144141.name: Temple of the Forbidden God
144141.description:
From back cover:

First, a man covered in moving tattoos is found floating in a river. Next, a high-ranking member of the Church of Kaga summons you. This can only be for a social visit...

User comments:

This introductory NeoExodus scenario for 2nd to 4th level characters was given away on Free RPG Day 2012.

144142.name: A Pot of Broken Bones (& Halfling Broth)
144142.description:
User summary:

A mini-adventure for the Castles & Crusades system, A Pot of Broken Bones (& Halfling Broth) was released on Free RPG Day 2013. This wintery tale in three acts pits players against two ornery trolls in a daring rescue mission.

Designed for characters of 5th to 8th level.

144143.name: Hall of Bones
144143.description:
From back cover:

Frog God Games is pleased to present a short handling of our rule set, game theory and a short adventure of the award winning SWORDS & WIZARDRY game.

The game is similar to very old school editions of the game, dating back to 1974. This was the game that came in a small brown (and later white) box, when men were men and well, henchmen were cannon fodder. What you will find herein is a ready-to-play adventure that can be run with only a few minutes of preparation.

144144.description:
From Publisher's Site:

Lead your team to victory on the bloodstained pitches of the greatest sport ever played!

With a host of new models, new mechanics and exciting abilities, the Season 2 Rulebook takes DreadBall to new heights and expands your gameplay experience. Featuring brand new photography as well as a dedicated FAQ section, the Season 2 Rulebook is a must-have for any DreadBall fan.

Season 2 Expands your DreadBall Experience with:
•64 Page A4 Full Colour Rulebook
•4 New Teams
Judwan (humanoid aliens)
Z'zor (insectoids)
Void Sirens (human variant team - female)
Chromium Chargers (robots)
•9 famous MVPs
•Cheerleaders
•Coaches
•Talk Tactics FAQ
•League Play
•New Abilities
144144.name: DreadBall: Season 2

144145.name: The Eiger Agenda
144145.description:
User summary:

The Eiger Agenda is a quickstart guide for Catalyst Game Labs' Cosmic Patrol. It is made for the 2013 Free RPG Day.

From the back of the book:

ROCKETS AND RAYGUNS

In Cosmic Patrol, players take the role of Patrolmen - the first and last line of defense for humans in a dangerous galaxy. Patrolmen explore, discover and defend the interest of humans wherever they go. With an atomic ray gun at their hip, they brave the unknown on a regular basis

Cosmic Patrol is a rules-light RPG by Catalyst Game Labs that is all about creating a story. Using Cues as building blocks, you will construct a plot and narrate your Patrolman's way through the millions of threats the cosmos has to offer. Your adventure will be unique to you and your group, and you're encouraged to write those adventures up in true pulp style, for all the world to enjoy.

144146.name: Tunse'al Quick Starts & Side Tracks (Savage Worlds)
144146.description:
From the back of the book:

Honor is everything.
Money does not exist.
And the World Really is Out to get YOU!

Play in a world where technology is slow to advance, tribes are divided by great geographical expanses, magic is scarce, trade is fraught with peril, dinosuar-like beasts co-exist with people, and the very environment poses danger to your party.

Tunse'al is a tribal, fantasy setting with four playable races that are outside the norm. The swamp-dwelling Kresh are an amphibious, genderless race committed to ensuring their sacred land, The Wetlands, is safe from greedy destruction. The cold-enduring Gelid use their pathfinding ways throughout the long stretches of the Baarek Mountains to explore and make peace wherever possible. The towering, red-skinned, two-horned Korrin pursue all things with passion in their free-form society of The Footlands' jungles. The thick-skinned, nomadic Gales with eyes resembling a snake's wander The Drylands' sands in search of desert gems, tar, and other commodities no one else would have any hope obtaining.

The Skin Eaters of The Dreamlands round out the dominant races, although they are only at the GM's disposal. They are the treacherous, twisted cousins to the Kresh. In her madness, their creator, Sa'ra, made the Skin Eaters dependent upon others' skins in order to live. They are not mindless, but no tribe trusts them as historical attempts to have a respectable relationship have always ended in bloodshed.

In conjunction with a Savage Worlds rule book, this guide contains enough to get you started on your own campaign and to fill in or stretch out sessions when players are absent or things go offtrack.

(Released for Free RPG Day 2013.)

144147.name: Hatfield vs McCoy "Gold Rush"
144147.description:
Hatfield vs. McCoy - "Gold Rush" is a dice / strategy table top game of hillbilly prospecting. Each family is seeking new gold mine claims. Roll your dice to pick up new claims, or become a claim jumper and try to take one from the other family. Roll your 5 rock, paper, scissors dice and bid them against a family member that holds that mine. The family with the most claims that hit gold at the end of the game wins!

This Box Contains:
5 Custom RPS Blue Dice
5 Custom RPS Red Dice
2 Custom Black Dice
8 Red Marker Pawns
8 Blue Marker Pawns
12 Prospecting Cards
3 Hatfield Family Cards
3 McCoy Family Cards
2 Game Guide Cards
And 1 Rule Book

144148.name: Streets of Bedlam: Five-Story Drop
144148.description:
From publisher blurb:

One false move. One bad deal. One broken promise. That’s all that stands between you and a one-way trip off the nearest skyscraper.

You manage to navigate the ins and outs, you’ll find yourself on the top of the heap. You stumble, you’ll spend the rest of your short life sucking wind until the concrete comes up to kiss you.

At least you’ll have lived a story worth telling, yeah?
Because in the end that’s what we’re all doing here.
Telling stories.

Five-Story Drop is a collection of episodes for Streets of Bedlam: A Savage World of Crime + Corruption.

Within these pages, you’ll run across a suburban cannibal cult, drug-running streetracers, a precinct-wide conspiracy, the return of a notorious serial killer, and a man who simply refuses to stay dead.

Five-Story Drop includes:

“Does a Body Good”
“Life in the Fast Lane”
“The Burial Plot”
“That Man’s Got a Real Backscratcher”
“Eli Mendoza is a Dead Man”

144149.name: Deluxe Tunnels & Trolls Preview Pack
144149.description:
User summary:

A first look at the Deluxe Tunnels & Trolls game, released on Free RPG Day 2013.

Includes introductory rules as well as a GM adventure by Bear Peters and Liz Danforth, The Chambers of Z'Tpozz The Mad Dwarf.

144150.description:
In the two-player game Four Tribes, each player takes on the role of a powerful monarch in conflict with the other during a time of famine. The war is at a stalemate, and both leaders decide that the key to destroying the other is to recruit the help of the Northern Tribes! Each player attempts to sway the Village Elders of the Four Tribes to join their cause by supplying each village with desperately needed supplies. Win the village, and you gain the favor of the Village Elder! Gain the favor of enough Village Elders, and you will win the support of the Four Tribes and be victorious!

While Four Tribes is a two-player game, a four-player variant will be part of the finished product.
144150.name: Four Tribes
boardgamepodcastepisode: AUG The Game of Crowd Funding Jason Glover Interview 01-15-2014

144151.name: Airport Tycoon 2
144151.description:
Airport Tycoon 2 is the sequel to Airport Tycoon in which the player builds and manages an airport. Airport Tycoon 2 adds new features like time to build, and disables custom terminals. The game was released on February 26, 2003 for the PC and was followed up by Airport Tycoon 3.

Source: Wikipedia, "Airport Tycoon 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

144152.name: Airport Tycoon 3
144152.description:
Airport Tycoon 3, the sequel to Airport Tycoon and Airport Tycoon 2, is a business simulation game in which the player builds and manages the biggest airport in the world. Airport Tycoon 3 takes away the time to build and allows for the customization of terminals, but not for custom terminal sizes. Several runways, prefabricated terminals, control towers, contractors, staff and airlines are available for use during the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Airport Tycoon 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

144154.name: Zeno Clash II
144154.description:
About Zeno Clash 2

Zeno Clash 2 is the sequel to ACE Team’s award winning punk fantasy game, renowned for its unique visuals and visceral first-person fighting mechanics. Set in the fascinating and disturbing world of Zenozoik, the first game put you in the role of Ghat, a man whose defiance of his clan’s leader and progenitor, ‘FatherMother’, tore their family apart.

Despite events that forced him to leave his home, Ghat never intended to reveal FatherMother’s dark secret, the reason for his defiance. However, after deciding to return with a mysterious being he’d met in his exile that called himself ‘Golem’, the secret came out. FatherMother was incarcerated and the clan went their separate ways.

Now, with FatherMother jailed and the family dissolved, the world of Zenozoik faces new hardships. Nobody knows why the Golem has decided to stay in Zenozoik, yet his power and knowledge are undeniable. Ghat finds this outsider’s imposition upon his home unacceptable, and wants to rid Zenozoik of his influence. Rimat simply wants the family to be reunited, but feels that Ghat is the only one she can turn to. The two form an uneasy alliance and embark upon a journey to change the future of Zenozoik.

FEATURES

A surreal world to explore:
The world of Zenozoik has been lovingly rendered with the Unreal III engine, allowing the madmen of ACE Team to fully capture the beauty of Zenozoik as it exists in their imagination. With Zeno Clash 2's added sidequests and item collection, players will be encouraged to explore this vast, unique world to their heart's content and discover all of its secrets.

Improved first person fighting system:
Pinpoint aiming and physics-based combat allow for a much richer first-person melee experience. New moves, weapons, and allies take first-person brawling to a whole new level!

Cooperative campaign:
Take control of Ghat or Rimat in the new co-op campaign. Seamless drop-in/drop-out co-op allows players to make allies out of other real-world Zeno Clash enthusiasts.

Source: The Game Website.

rpgitemversion: Free RPG Day 2013 print "Shadows of a Black Sun"
144155.name: Shadows of a Black Sun
rpg: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire
144155.description:
From the back of the book:

Amid a backdrop of civil war, the Empire tightens its grip on the galaxy. Yet, even the Emperor's influence only extends so far. At the edge of Imperial power lies a den of smugglers and crime lords, bounty hunters and petty thieves, all seeking to make their fortunes or just survive another day.

Embark on your own adventures in the Star Wars galaxy with the introductory adventure, Shadows of a Black Sun. After a space deal goes awry, the players must enter the seedy underworld of Coruscant and track down a double-dealing bounty hunter. Can they dodge Black Sun thugs and Imperial forces to put an end to his treachery one and for all?

This Free RPG Day booklet also includes:


Quick-start rules for Star Wars: Edge of the Empire.
Four pre-generated characters. Play as a human scoundrel, a Rodian trader, a Bothan slicer, or a Trandoshan marauder.
A complete planetary adventure over for Coruscant, rules for playing sabacc, exclusive adversaries, and an adventure map.

144156.name: Fairy Fencer F
videogamehonor: 2014 Operation Rainfall Awards Best PlayStation Console Game of the Year Nominee
2014 Operation Rainfall Awards Hottest Guy of the Year Nominee
144156.description:
A long time ago there was a conflict between a goddess and an evil god. The two deities didn’t fight directly, but created a large number of special weapons for others to use. Eventually, these powers sealed each other and the power vanished from the world. Fast forward to modern times where these leftover weapons are called "Furies" and warriors that wield them are "Fencers." Fury weapons are said to be incredibly powerful, so Fencers constantly scramble to acquire them. By a strange coincidence, two fencers, Fang and Tiara, get caught up in the struggle between the goddess and evil god.

Source: Wikipedia, "Fairy Fencer F", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

144157.name: Zero Gunner
144157.description:
Zero Gunner is a shoot 'em up developed by Psikyo and released in 1997. The arcade game allows for eight-way movement using a joystick and supports up to two players at a time. It was notable for its lock on targeting mechanic that allowed players to rotate around targets. The game was succeeded by a sequel, Zero Gunner 2 for the Sega NAOMI/Dreamcast.

Source: Wikipedia, "Zero Gunner", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

144158.name: Palace in Thunderland
144158.description:
User Summary

Meet the Queen of Hearts and the White Rabbit in this Alice in Wonderland inspired adventure.

144159.name: Sports Champions 2
144159.description:
Compete against friends and family in six fun-packed events.


Grab your PlayStation Move motion controller and go for gold in all-new events - golf, boxing, bowling, skiing, tennis and an updated archery mode.
Create tournaments for up to four players, customise your character's look and save your individual stats and profile as you compete to win the gold medal.
Set up events for family and friends in the new Party Mode - compete in customisable tournaments, choosing your own rules and favourite sports.


Source: The Publisher Website.

144160.name: Until Dawn
videogamehonor: 2015 Gamescom Best Action Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Global Game Awards Best Horror Game of the Year Winner
2015 Global Game Awards Most Original Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best PS4 Game Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best Video Game Visuals/Artwork Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Most Innovative Video Game Nominee
2015 The Game Awards Best Narrative of the Year Nominee
2016 British Academy Game Awards Best British Game of the Year Nominee
2016 British Academy Game Awards Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
2016 British Academy Game Awards Best Story/Narrative of the Year Nominee
2016 British Academy Game Awards Most Original Game of the Year Winner
2016 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Narrative of the Year Nominee
2016 SXSW Best Technical Advancement of the Year Nominee
144160.description:
The game follows a group of teenagers as they spend the night in a log cabin on the anniversary of the death of one of their friends.

The player assumes the role of different characters in the group as they try to survive a night on the mountain, pursued by an unknown assailant.

Source: Wikipedia, "Until Dawn", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

144161.name: Wizardry Online
144161.description:
Like many MMORPGs, players can create their own character and explore and advance in an open world with other players that are also connected. A player may create a character using a variety of class/race/attribute combinations found commonly in most MMORPGs. A more dangerous addition to the gameplay is the potential for Permanent death also known as Permadeath. Upon character death, you have a chance of losing your character forever. The chance of losing your character can be reduced by sacrificing items.

Source: Wikipedia, "Wizardry Online", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

144162.name: Hitman HD Trilogy
144162.description:
User Summary

The Hitman HD Trilogy was released to introduce new players to the three latest Hitman games as well as give old players one Hitman package. The Hitman Triple Pack contains the same 3 Hitman games as the HD Trilogy, except not in HD.

144163.name: Mechanised Warfare Rules
144163.description:
User Description

A set of simple fast play wargame rules designed for fighting large scale battles using 6mm and 2mm scale miniatures. They cover the period from 1935 to the present day.

They also have WWII army lists, supplement rules for post 1945 and air to ground aircraft rules.

They have been designed to use a D6 dice and minitures which are multiable based in to units (dependent on scale).

144164.name: Johnny get your gun
144164.description: A spin and move game where you are trying to shoot the most valuable big game animals using a spinner shaped lie a gun.

144165.name: Scurvy Scallywags
144165.description:
Scurvy Scallywags is part match-3 game, part RPG, part Broadway musical, and entirely fun! Your pirate character appears on a classic-style match-3 game board, along with loot to be plundered, valuable quest items, and enemies who want you dead. When you match three or more tiles the board shifts in the direction you swiped, so you can use strategy to line up your pirate with items you need or avoid monsters stronger than you.

Source: The Developer Website.

144166.name: Spellbound (1984)
144166.description:
From the inlay (Soft Aid compilation):

You have been captured and turned into a toad by Griselda and her pet spider, Manfred. You must escape from the pyramid by treading on every one of the pyramid steps. You get Three lives in each level and there are twelve levels in all and in each level Griselda sends different demons, ghosts, skeletons, spells etc. after you.

User Summary

Spellbound is a clone of the Gottlieb arcade classic Q*bert. However the game has been re-themed such that the enemies are creatures summoned by the evil witch.

Credits:

Program by Pat W. Norris

144168.name: The Pyramid
videogameversion: ZX Spectrum (Paxman Promotions re-release) Cassette edition
144168.description:
From the inlay (Soft Aid Compilation):

The Pyramid contains 120 chambers on 15 levels. In order to get from one chamber to another you must fight off the indigenous aliens to collect an energised crystal which will neutralize the force field guarding the two exits. The Pyramid is inhabited by a total of 60 weird and exotic alien types. Apart from going for a high score the Pyramid contains a number puzzle to solve, the more chambers successfully visited, the more information is gathered to enable you to solve the puzzle of the Pyramid.

User Summary

In The Pyramid, the user starts exploring from a top of a great Pyramid. Each block rest upon two others. Within each block, the user controls a spaceman which can fly up, down, left or right. Enemies fall from the ceiling or rise from the floor and they must be either avoided or shot until a diamond appears. This opens two exits at the bottom of the level which lead either to the lower left or right block. The player therefore navigates down the Pyramid, but every game is slightly different if they make different selections.

144169.name: Crimson Cutlass
144169.description:
user summary

A hand-assembled boxed set (generic stationery box with a cardstock slipcover) released by Better Games around 1990 containing the 1989 revision of the original three books plus a full-sized character sheet for the game.

the original books are:
Crimson Cutlass Book One
Crimson Cutlass Book Two
Crimson Cutlass Book Three

144170.name: Retro Rampage Trivia Quest
144170.description: Retro Rampage Trivia Quest is a table top trivia game focusing on classic games and consoles, ranging from the Nintendo Entertainment System and Sega Master System, up until the Super Nintendo, Sega Genesis, and even the Turbografx-16 and the PC Engine.

144171.description:
Small World: Royal Bonus is a mini-expansion for Small World that contains three Races (Fauns, Igors and Shrubmen) and three Special Powers (Aquatic, Behemoth and Fireball). Royal Bonus was first released only to Kickstarter backers of the digital version of Small World.

On September 8 Days of Wonder announced that the Royal Bonus would again be available at retail in November 2014.
144171.name: Small World: Royal Bonus

144172.name: The Hawkeye Football Game
144172.description:
Using American Football fundamentals, players simulate an Iowa Hawkeye football game with charts, dice, and an exact replica Kinnick Field game board.

Game-Play: The defensive player secretly selects one of three defensive formations (running, blitzing, and passing) and marks it with his d6. Then, the offensive player verbally selects one of tweleve running or passing plays. The defensive player exposes his formation, and the offensive player rolls 2d10 to reveal the outcome of the play from the play chart. Play results include, but are not limited to: incomplete pass, interception, sack, penalty, touchdown, no gain, or a yardage gain of another dice roll. Game time and score are tracked on a separate charts. Special team results are also covered on a field goal, kick-off, and punt chart.

Contents: 2 play charts, 1 exact replica of Kinnick Field game board, 1 field goal and penalty chart, 1 official time chart, scorepad, 1 line-of-scrimmage marker, 1 ten-yard marker, 3 colored markers, 2 offensive dice (d10), 1 defensive die (d6), 1 rules folder, and 1 Hawkeye button (1st issue Collectors Edition only).

The game rules do not cover the sport of American Football; therefore, basic knowledge of the sport should be known or referenced with a NCAA college football handbook.

144173.name: Jolly Roger - Piraten in der Karibik
144173.description:
User summary

Jolly Roger - Piraten in der Karibik (Jolly Roger - Pirates in the Caribbean) is a pirate sourcebook. It contains stats for Midgard (3rd Edition) and Midgard Abenteuer 1880, but can be used with other systems as well.

The first print run had a size of 250 copies. It is unknown if there ever was a second printing.

The book contains

A history of piracy
Famous pirates
Lands and islands of the New World
Tortuga
Life on the seas
Life as a pirate
Ships of the 17th and 18th century
New classes and skills
New combat rules and naval combat
Weather rules
Adventure seeds
Two full-length adventures:
Der Schatz von Captain Crumble (Captain Crumble's Treasure)
Jagd auf die Kriegsbarkasse (Hunt for the War Barge)

144174.description:
“There ain’t no AYE in team, but there is MEAT. And that’s you when we’re done.”

-Coach Dru

The Goblins approach Kaosball with the same attitude they approach life: We'll do things our own way. Worstshire's reputation as a rough and rowdy town with little to recommend it is well deserved. The Goblins are Kaosball’s anarchs, the team who spit on authority and defy convention. Their team power turns the crossfield into a giant mosh pit, and if your runners or bruisers are surrounded by Goblins, prepare to be crowd-surfed right out of the action!

This is a Kickstarter and convention exclusive team!
144174.name: Kaosball: Team – Worstshire Goblins
boardgameexpansion: Kaosball: The Fantasy Sport of Total Domination

144175.name: Die Minotauren
144175.description:
User summary

Die Minotauren (The minotaurs) is an introductory fantasy RPG. It was available for free on RPC 2010.

This rulebook contains a short summary of the game world and the player races. It provides rules for task resolution, character creation, combat and magic.

The book is printed with full-color artwork.

144176.description:
Boardgame "U Koryta" is a satire of political and social issues, the realities of the political fictional world, localized somewhere between the fall of the Fourth Republic and the birth of Fifth Republic.
Players take the role of gray eminences. They leads political parties and their choices affect both the shape the political scene, but also the condition of the state.

http://www.bellringer.pl/u-koryta,3.html
144176.name: U Koryta

144177.description:
"It's just a game man... Chill out!"

Kongbad is one of the most memorable ringers in the game today, and not simply because he's a huge ape. His laidback and easygoing approach to life, love and Kaosball make him a fan favorite!

He's made a long career manipulating play to cost opponents points in unusual ways, and he's very good at it.

Kickstarter and convention exclusive Ringer.
144177.name: Kaosball: Ringer – Kongbad
boardgameexpansion: Kaosball: The Fantasy Sport of Total Domination

144178.name: Schattenkatalog 3
144178.description:
User summary

Schattenkatalog 3 (Shadow Catalogue 3) is a print compilation of several PDF publications and some new material.

It contains:

Safehouses
Magical Societies
The Way of the Samurai
The Way of the Adept
Parazoology
Parabotany
State of the Art: 2073
Die Autobahn lebt! (The Highway is alive) - Highways in the ADL (Shadowrun Germany)
New drones




Schattenkatalog 3 was published in a numbered limited edition with a print run of 800 books.

144180.name: Ordensbuch Ramieliten
144180.description:
User summary

Ordensbuch Ramieliten (Order Book: Ramielites) is a sourcebook for Die Chroniken der Engel describing the followers of the arch angel Jeremiel. They are keepers of wisdom and knowledge based in eastern Europe with the order's castle located in Prague. The book contains a poster map of the castle.

144181.name: Axis Empires Expansion Kit
144181.description:
From the publisher's web site:

AE/EK includes more cards, counters, and scenarios about TK and DS. Includes the Seekrieg naval units. Small maps, 280 counters, 100 cards, 48-page booklet. Thomas Prowell/Alan Emrich.

144182.description:
The goal of Galtoni is to connect 4 balls in a straight (diagonal or orthogonal) line. Unlike in other games with this concept, however, there is a randomizer involved, as the game is played on a type of Galton box. Players take turns inserting a ball in one of the openings at the top of the slanted board. It hits a series of pins which deflect it, before falling into one of seven slots at the bottom. The first player who manages to form a straight line of four balls in his/her color is the winner.
There are two neutral balls included as well, which both players can use for their lines.
In a variant, the balls are randomly drawn from a bag, so a players sometimes insert balls that belong to the other player, trying to put it into a useless position.
144182.name: Galtoni

144183.name: Trivial Pursuit: Edicio Barça
144183.description:
This edition of the Trivial Pursuit game is dedicated to the history of F.C. Barcelona (Barça).

The mechanics of the game aer similar to the other Trivial Pursuit games, with questions about players, games , history and other sports sections of F.C. Barcelona.

144184.name: Road to the Palace
144184.description:
Once upon a time, there was an old kingdom, where executives manipulated complicated relationships in order to gain fame and fortune. The players are these executives; the goal of the game earning as much influence in the royal palace as possible, all the while downing the rivals.

Character cards are lined up in a 3 x 4 grid. Players take turns gaining one of these cards each, combined with a so-called "mission disc". After each player has taken a card, discs and possibly cards are refilled, and the next player chooses a card to take. When the round is finished, players earn points for the discs of the colours of which he has the most influence, and penalty points for certain others.

Game goes on for two rounds, and the player with the most points at the end wins.

144185.name: Charted Areas
144185.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Charted Areas are an optional tool that you can use to start your game of The Quiet Year quicker, and to hone in on a particular kind of landscape.

Charted Areas complete the prep stages of the game for you (sketching the terrain, determining starting resources). Simply pick the map you’d like to use, and begin.

If you’re playing with two players, cross out one of the Scarcities before you start (and do the same with its symbolic representation on the map, if clear). If you’re playing with four players, add a final Scarcity before you start.

144186.name: Funky Smugglers
144186.description:
Funky Smugglers combines awesome 70s atmosphere with massive multiplayer events for endless arcade fun!

Some of the things smugglers try to get through the airport are incredible. There's a spider in grandma's suitcase?! A racketeer is hiding a plunger?! Holy smoke! Luckily, you have an X-Ray scanner to check their clothes and luggage for wacky contraband. Enjoy a funky 70s-style soundtrack while keeping the airport safe from hammers, scissors, and other illegal goods.

Join huge multiplayer battles where you fight for high scores! Dive into challenging randomized missions! Use multi-touch or a one-finger slide to pick up multiple items and chain together combos! Boost your X-ray! Earn in-game cash to spend on customization, new contraband, new smugglers and exciting upgrades!

Source: The Developer Website.

144187.description:
"The game may have changed, but our principles have not" - Coach Z

The Paragons are a beacon of truth and righteousness in the bloody sport of Kaosball. By focusing their team’s collective soul, they can temporarily sacrifice themselves to boost their teammates to superhuman feats and score like you wouldn’t believe!
144187.name: Kaosball: Team – St. Cloud Paragons
boardgameexpansion: Kaosball: The Fantasy Sport of Total Domination

144188.description:
“Size is nothing. Power and control are everything.”

-Coach Prof

Moonshire is a dangerous place, where any unassuming science major could be moonlighting as a monstrous terror of the night. Enter the Lycanthropes, champion team of this cursed land, who use this newfound control over immense lupine power at will. Bruiser wolf or runner human? Why choose?
144188.name: Kaosball: Team – Moonshire Lycanthropes
boardgameexpansion: Kaosball: The Fantasy Sport of Total Domination

boardgamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best Solo Board Game Nominee
144189.description:
(from GMT website:)

Volume IV in GMT’s COIN Series dives headlong into the momentous and complex battle for South Vietnam. A unique multi-faction treatment of the Vietnam War, Fire in the Lake will take 1 to 4 players on US heliborne sweeps of the jungle and Communist infiltration of the South, and into inter-allied conferences, Saigon politics, interdiction of the Ho Chi Minh Trail, air defense of Northern infrastructure, graduated escalation, and media war.

Renowned designer and modern warfare expert Mark Herman joins COIN Series creator Volko Ruhnke for a collaborative production not to be missed. Fire in the Lake features the same card-assisted counterinsurgency game system as GMT's Andean Abyss, Cuba Libre, and A Distant Plain, with a pack of twists that take the Series to another level, including:


Pivotal events that trump initiative (Tet Offensive, Vietnamization, Easter Offensive, and Linebacker II)
Inter-coup campaign effects that vary by RVN leader
Counterinsurgent guerrillas (US-led Irregulars and ARVN Rangers)
Insurgent troops (NVA) for direct force-on-force engagements
Tunneled VC and NVA bases
Trail construction and degradation
A larger-than-ever event deck for even greater play variety
Short and medium-length scenarios with either random or period-event options


COMPONENTS:
One 22"x34" Map
248 Wooden pieces (many embossed)
130 Playing Cards
One full-color countersheet
Rules Booklet
Play Booklet
9 Player Aid sheets
Three 6-sided dice

DESIGNER: Mark Herman & Volko Ruhnke
SERIES DEVELOPER: Mike Bertucelli
MAP ART: Chechu Nieto
COUNTER & CARDS ART & RULES LAYOUT: Mark Simonitch
144189.name: Fire in the Lake
boardgamepodcastepisode: Board2Death Podcast Episode 5 - Introductions Round One
Ep 4 - Asymmetrical Games
Episode 3 - Playtesting And Jamey Stegmaier Interview
Episode 41 -- Lightning Table Clearance Round
Episode 47 -- Four Coins in a Fountain
Episode 66 Part 1 : Totally Gaming (I say Xenon, you say Zion)
Gaming Rules! – Podcast 27
GrogCast Season 2, Episode 13
Heavy Cardboard Episode 9 – Vinhos
I've Been Diced! episode 51: The PrezCon 2014 edition
I've Been Diced! episode 66: Combat systems
I've Been Diced! episode 67: Mark Herman
I've Been Diced! episode 71: Mutants, game studies, and 2015 in review
Low Player Count - Ep 14 - Free Form
Podblast: 2014 Golden Elephant Heavy Game of the Year
The Game Pit: Episode 24 - Treasure Hunt - Part One
The Long View: Republic of Rome
Travis Gets Heavy - Ep. 1 - The COIN Series
Travis Gets Heavy - Episode 5 - Harold Buchanan Interview
Wild Weasel 3
Wild Weasel 6

144190.name: Operation: Alignment
144190.description:
Author Summary:

A summer solstice themed espionage adventure for the Debrief system. Presented as both a full document and a pocketMod 'dossier' for easy concealment when on assignment.

144191.name: Shadows of Esteren: Loch Varn Tiles
144191.description:
From the package insert:

This supplement for Shadows of Esteren includes five sets of cardboard tiles depicting the twists and turns of a Magientist ruin. Features include:
-About 30 different tiles divided into 5 sets
-Specifically intended for the Loch Varn scenario
-One-inch scale

144193.name: Gilligan's Gold
144193.description:
From the inlay (Soft Aid compilation):

Place the bags of gold in your wheelbarrow before the time runs out. Each bag increases your time and score, but beware, the outlaws are after you - and the gold.

You can escape by jumping on the trucks (by hanging on the hooks) or via the ladders and lifts, but watch out for the deadly, deep mine-shafts. The outlaws can be stunned by dropping the bags of gold on them.

User Summary

Gilligan's Gold is a clone of the 1982 Valadon Automation arcade game Bagman.

144195.name: Age of Treason: The Iron Companion
144195.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sooner or later every wandering Adventurer finds his way to Sorandib, whether the aim is to hide out from authority, find work as a sell-sword or simply to loot its treasures.

Sorandib is an ancient city in catastrophic decline. While there are districts wher law and order hold sway, no single force exercises control over the whole city and outside its walls there is near anarchy to the West, while Taskan soldiers maintain some order in the East to keep the road to the imperial heartlands open.

Sorandib has been kept alive by two things: its control over the trade in Fengo, a drug harvested from the weeds that choke lake Barur to the North; and the creations of the Guild of Artificers, a centuries-old association of sorcerer-scientists who are famous for their inventions, feats of engineering and practical devices – many of which are built into the very fabric of the city.

Just as the Emperor owes his immortality to magic provided by the king of Sorandib, the city will surely play a role in his final ascension to the heavens. The cult of Thesh in Taskay has its eye on direct control not only of the Artificers but of the fire-demon Sorantar who is the city’s god. The Iron Simulacrum himself looks to Sorandib as the place he will discover his fate when the Emperor departs the physical plane, where he might be unmade in such a way as to find the key to a continued existence as an independent soul. Sorandib could be the scene of Treason on a world-shattering scale.

Age of Treason: The Iron Companion provides a comprehensive view of this famous city, including maps, floor plans, NPCs, cults, scenarios and rules for creating Artifice.

Also in this book are new spells, price lists, new rules for training, henchmen and hirelings, running a business and using Passion traits in the setting. Comprehensive Spirit Magic rules synthesise the Legend rules and the Setting rules into a single document, and statistics are provided for Elementals, including the bizarre Flesh Elemental, the Blemmye.

In addition to the fully detailed scenarios set in Sorandib, the Companion describes six major treasonous plots to form the backdrop for further adventures, as well as suggested plotlines for scenarios set on the wild frontiers of Marangia and Kitan.

144196.name: Jack and the Beanstalk
144196.description:
From the inlay (Soft Aid compilation):

As Jack you have to search for the castle's riches, being careful not to wake the giant sleeping in the parlour. For each task you must collect the specific item and escape deeper into the giant's castle, fighting off creatures and being very careful where you tread!

144199.name: Gumshoe
144199.description:
User Summary

In Gumshoe you play a private detective hired to rescue a millionaire's daughter who has been kidnapped. It is a platform game where the player has to search across 10 tower blocks where the gang is hiding out.

The player must dodge bullets fired by the kidnappers, by moving up and down ladders, lifts and dropping through trapdoors. Also laundry chutes can be used to quickly move between different areas of the building.

Of course, as a private investigator, you are concerned about income and expenditure. At the end of each life, a screen is shown with your expenses, including a cost for each bullet fired, and your income, such as a bounty for each enemy killed.

144200.name: Star Trader
144200.description:
User Summary

Star Trader is reminiscent of the classic Elite in that the player is in command of a spaceship with an objective to make as much money as possible by buying and selling goods, and transporting them to other worlds. Like Elite, the journeys are fraught with danger and can result in space battles which are played out in first-person from the cockpit of your spacecraft.

Unlike Elite, there are more things to do when not in Space. You must eat in order to maintain your strength and run the risk of being mugged. Also instead of a single shop to buy goods, the player has a choice of various locations, such as a gunsmith, a wine merchant, a general store, etc. Each action takes time in the day, and the availability of locations depends on the time of day.

In the Commodore 64 version, up to 8 players can play. Each user takes turns to conduct half a day of activities.

144201.name: China Miner
144201.description:
User Summary

China Miner is a platformer in the mould of the classic Manic Miner.

You play a miner called Wally who is infiltrating forgotten Chinese mines in search of various treasures. Each level also contains a key, which must be picked up in order to advance to the next of 30 levels. Wally must be guided around various bizarre creatures which have taken up residence in the mines.

The game plays a rather nice rendition of Scott Joplin's "Maple Leaf Rag" during play.

144202.name: Gyropod
144202.description:
User Summary:

In Gyropod, the player is tasked with the defence of a large spaceship. The ship has a central component housing the engines connected to a large ring component. You command a pod which runs around the rim of the ring. Your ship must be at the correct point on the ring to shoot the incoming enemy fighters.

The ship and the pod have separate shields. You also have limited ammunition. When the pod's shields or ammunition are running low, you can transfer to a planet. It is essential to fire retro-rockets when landing for a smooth landing.

When on the planet, the player must continue to dodge or shoot aliens while the ammunition supply is replenished, but you must leave before your air supply runs out.

144203.name: Flak
144203.description:
From the back of the box:

Put yourself in the pilot's seat of an advanced AGX hypersonic fighter! The year is 2096 and the time is now. Your mission is to destroy COMPUTER CONTROL, a renegade CPU out to take over the universe. You'll fly in low over awe-inspiring scenery whose beauty just might be your end. Guarding the approach to its fortress is an endless array of computer controlled FLAK batteries. They always seem to know where you are and where you'll be. You fire, evade, fire again... Your hand tightens around the flight control, you push harder on the fire button, the tension builds... Can you take it? Will you survive the FLAK?

User Summary:
