144404.name: Olympian Breed: Setting Primer & Character Creation Guide
144404.description:
From the introduction:
Olympian Breed by Palewolf Publishing is a table top roleplaying game set in the Greek heroic age. This game uses the core rules set of the Savage Worlds, Deluxe Edition, the Super Powers Companion (for the God-like powers) and the Fantasy Companion (for the mythical monsters). You need access to all three of these essential resource books in order to create characters and to play in this setting. Fast! Furious! Fun!

With the information contained here and in future releases, you bring your players into an epic tale of high adventure in ancient Greece and beyond. Each release is complete game session with story elements, plot hooks, detailed NPC’s and Game Master tips. The stories can be presented to players as “one shot episodes” or as part of a whole campaign with story threads to tie it all together.

144405.name: Olympian Breed: Pregens
144405.description:
From the introduction:
Maybe you’ve had some trouble deciding on what kind of demigod to create? Perhaps you just want to get some ideas or need a new NPC Wild Card to travel with the party for a time? Need some characters because you just want to start playing right away, perchance?

Well, we’ve got exactly what you needed. YAY!!

The PREGENS for Olympian Breed are now available for FREE download on DriveThruRPG!!

The download contains 4 demigod hero PREGENS for use with Olympian Breed, Act One: A Gathering of Heroes – an Adventure for Savage Worlds™. Use them as-is, change their names and backgrounds, or alter their traits and gear however you desire. You can even copy them onto an Olympian Breed character sheet if you like.

144406.name: Olympian Breed: Act One
144406.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Olympian Breed

Heroes Demigods Legends

This download contains the first story/session of Olympian Breed, the epic tale of high adventure in ancient Greece and beyond.

We recommend that you also download our FREE setting primer and custom character sheet before you begin play.

ACT ONE: A GATHERING OF HEROES

As all of Argos celebrates the end of the Crown Princess’s courtship and the announcement of her betrothal, a shadow from the past rises to destroy all their hopes.

144407.name: Olympian Breed: Act Two
144407.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Olympian Breed

Heroes Demigods Legends

This download contains the second story/session of Olympian Breed, the epic tale of high adventure in ancient Greece and beyond.

We recommend that you also download our FREE setting primer and custom character sheet and the begining of the story Act One before you begin play.

ACT TWO: The Island of Love

The trail of Sihon leads the Questors of Argos across the sea, towards the Island of Kythira. But even as they relentlessly advance, dark forces muster intent on seeing them destroyed as vengeance for the sins of others.

144408.name: Gone Home
videogamehonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best Indie Video Game Nominee
2013 Golden Geek Most Innovative Video Game Nominee
2013 IGF Awards Excellence In Audio Nominee
2013 IGF Awards Excellence in Narrative Nominee
2013 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Nominee
2013 IndieCade Best Audio Design of the Year Winner
2013 Spike (VGX) Best Independent Game of the Year Winner
2013 Spike (VGX) Best PC Game of the Year Winner
2014 British Academy Game Awards Best Debut Game of the Year Winner
2014 British Academy Game Awards Best Story/Narrative of the Year Nominee
2014 D.I.C.E. Downloadable Game of the Year Nominee
2014 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Downloadable Game of the Year Nominee
2014 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
2014 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Narrative of the Year Nominee
2014 Game Developers Choice Awards Best New IP of the Year Winner
2014 Game Developers Choice Awards Game of the Year Nominee
144408.description:
Gone Home is a story exploration video game set in 1995. Investigate the Greenbriar family’s house. Discover what’s happened to them. Go home again.

PC, Mac & Linux, scheduled for release in 2013.

Source: The Developer Website.

144410.name: Final Fantasy XIV: A Realm Reborn
videogamehonor: 2012 Gamescom Best PC Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Spike (VGX) Best RPG of the Year Nominee
2014 Japan Game Awards Game of the Year Winner
2016 British Academy Game Awards Best Persistent Game of the Year Nominee
144410.description:
Square Enix Ltd., the publisher of SQUARE ENIX® interactive entertainment products in Europe and other PAL territories, announced today the fully-redesigned massively multiplayer online adventure FINAL FANTASY® XIV title. Rebranded FINAL FANTASY® XIV: A Realm Reborn™, and previously referenced as “version 2.0,” this adventure has been rebuilt from the ground up, and centers on the core concept of rebirth, featuring a new world to explore and storyline to experience.

FINAL FANTASY XIV: A Realm Reborn offers visually-stunning graphics and game design that appeal to both Windows PC and PlayStation®3 players.
“Since announcing our plans for the future of the title last October, we have been working tirelessly to include all of the elements that we have promised in FINAL FANTASY XIV: A Realm Reborn, which we announced today. This new title not only becomes a symbol of a completely new FINAL FANTASY XIV, but also marks the beginning of a new stage as the latest title in the FINAL FANTASY series. I hope you’re looking forward to it!” said Naoki Yoshida, Producer/Director of FINAL FANTASY XIV.

A new website dedicated to FINAL FANTASY XIV: A Realm Reborn (www.finalfantasyxiv.com) which offers background information on the realm of Eorzea, its inhabitants and the much larger world of Hydaelyn. The website will also serve as the central location for regular updates and news about the game.

Source: The Official Press Release (behind Pay Wall).

144411.name: Conan the Barbarian
144411.description: SPI's planned Conan the Barbarian adventure game, which featured a full-color map of Hyboria and counters for every major character. A prepub playtest kit was released. The comprehensive background material was written by L. Sprague de Camp.

144412.description:
Power Play: Schemes & Skulduggery is a new kind of storytelling game, a "Competitive Narrative Game". In the game, you will take on the role of a supernatural mastermind with a villainous plot to execute. The first to put all the pieces of his secret plot into place can declare himself the winner!

Power Play: Schemes & Skulduggery is not a role-playing game. You will not act out your character's actions, you will not need to adhere to any in-game moral code or class restrictions, and you will not need to keep your out-of-game knowledge separate from your in-game knowledge. On your turns, simply dictate your actions, and they come to pass. Utilize secret actions, your supernatural powers, the resources of your vast agency, and superior planning to gain an advantage and be the first to complete your objective.

Power Play: Schemes & Skulduggery is underhanded, unrestricted supervillainy in a free-form, open environment. We like to think of it as "the Grand Theft Auto of storytelling games".
144412.name: Power Play: Schemes & Skulduggery

144413.description:
Shindig Machine is a series of collaborative storytelling games for 3-8 players. You work with (or against) the other players using a custom deck of striking black and white 108 cards to tell the future, slander fictitious politicians, diagnose rare diseases, and meddle with movies like a studio executive.

Shindig Machine includes more than a dozen game types, with play times to fit any attention span. Get your friends together and have fun!
144413.name: Shindig Machine
boardgamepodcastepisode: Shindig Machine
The Party Gamecast Reviews - Episode #1 - Shindig Machine

144414.name: The Ranger Animal Fair
144414.description: A sort of bingo game where using a spinner players try to fill in the animals on their card by spinning the animal on the large spinner

144415.description:
Harbor life, merchant ships, and boxes full of valuable goods in the heyday of the Hanseatic League – this is the setting for Nauticus from designers Wolfgang Kramer and Michael Kiesling. Each player runs a shipyard and tries to assemble ships of various sizes in order to ship goods with those same vessels. Time is short as each action can be executed only once per round, assembly of the masts and sails must be precisely coordinated, and the goods can be shipped only when the ship is complete. Thanks to the customized action wheels, everyone is always involved in the game's rapid sequence of actions.

Whoever builds the biggest ships and ships the most valuable goods will be the winner in the end.
144415.name: Nauticus
boardgamepodcastepisode: Dukes of Dice - Ep. 62 - Rise of the Dress Lords
Garrett's Games 397 - Nauticus and Bruxelles 1893

144416.description:
Manno Monster is a game about monster-parties. Several of such parties have been planned, but only certain monsters have been invited!

There are two times three types of monsters in the game (fat vs thin, red vs blue vs yellow). Each player receives fifteen tiles. Each tile shows a monster on one side, and another monster on the other side (each possible duo of six monster types once). Each round, a card is drawn, that graphically shows which monsters have been invited to the party, such as: "exactly two large red monsters", "at least one small blue monster". In higher difficulty levels the tasks are fuzzier, such as "more yellow monsters than red monsters" or "just as many blue as fat monsters".

After revealing a card with the task description, all players attempt to flip their tiles in real time, so that the invited monsters are shown. The first player that succeeds in doing so collects the most valuable diamond. Other players can still score, too, if they manage to complete the task within the alotted time, started by the first player who (thinks he) fulfilled the task.
After nine rounds, the player who collected best-scored diamonds is declared the winner.

The game comes with six difficulty levels, each level having 18 tasks on the cards.
144416.name: Manno Monster

144417.description:
The hobbits' unexpected journey continues in Der Hobbit: Smaugs Einöde. In Mirkwood, Bilbo and his comrades meet sneaky spiders and must flee from hostile wood elves, but the most dangerous enemy proves to be the dragon Smaug, who sets out to destroy Bilbo and the hobbits, attacking them again and again, only to see himself pushed back. Will the hobbits be able to reach the Lonely Mountain? Only by working together can the players win this game.

Contents:

1 rule book
1 game board
1 6-sided die
1 Ring
1 Smaug token
1 Bilbo pawn
1 Gandalf pawn
8 dwarf pawns (2 for each of the 4 player colors)
120 playing cards:
47 Beorn's House cards
16 Mirkwood cards
16 Erebor cards
16 Esgaroth cards
8 treasure chamber cards
1 card "Thorin's Key"
144417.name: Der Hobbit: Smaugs Einöde
boardgameexpansion: Der Hobbit: Smaugs Einöde – Smaug: Die Mini-Erweiterung

144418.name: Wien Catan
144418.description: In the limited edition game Wien Catan, players can now build the Austrian metropolis! The board shows Vienna and its surroundings. Building only roads will not suffice; it is also necessary to build famous attractions such as the Ferris wheel or the St. Stephen's Cathedral.

144419.description:
This extension for Catan: Explorers & Pirates allows a fifth and sixth player to join in the building, trading, colonizing, fishing, sailing, pirate battling, and spice trading fun. Catan: Explorers & Pirates - 5-6 Player Extension adds components for two more people to play Catan: Explorers & Pirates, the fourth major expansion for The Settlers of Catan.

Belongs to the Catan Series.

Expands (all are required):

Catan
Catan: 5-6 Player Extension
Catan: Explorers & Pirates
144419.name: Catan: Explorers & Pirates – 5-6 Player Extension
boardgameaccessory: Catan: Explorers & Pirates – Wooden Viking Pieces

144420.description:
UNRELEASED GAME



Note that all details for this game are preliminary. If you have information about this game, you are invited to edit this section or submit corrections.




Nichtlustig: Noch mehr Labor Chaos is a chaotic card game based on the webcomic Nichtlustig. The game is played with 80 cards. Each player is dealt a hand of cards and has to get rid of them as quickly as possible, but other players will force them to draw new cards throughout the game.

Integrates with:

NichtLustig: Labor Chaos
144420.name: Nichtlustig: Noch mehr Labor Chaos

144421.name: The Book of Arcane Magic Web Enhancement: Reborn Soul Sorcerer Bloodline
144421.description:
User summary:

Web Enhancement for The Book of Arcane Magic detailing the sorcerer bloodline "Reborn Soul"

144423.description: An upgrade kit that was made available to owners of the first edition when the second edition was produced. It included the new board and cards to play the second edition version of the game.
144423.name: Canal Mania Upgrade Kit

144424.name: Technical Readout: 3067
144424.description:
Catalyst Labs Reprint

From the back of the book:
In the savage FedCom Civil War that rocked the Lyran Alliance and the Federated Commonwealth for the past five years, new machines of war have been rapidly tested and put in the field to help turn the tide of battle in each faction's favor. The Clans and other Houses have also been busy, as the internal and external conflicts drive the rapid deployment of new military hardware.

Battletech Technical Readout: 3067 provides descriptions, game statistics and illustrations for new BattleMech and vehicle designs. It finally unveils the next generation of Inner Sphere aerospace fighters and OmniFighters, as well as the Clan's second-line fighters. A handful of new DropShips are also premiered. This technical readout includes those designs previously published in the Field Manual Series.

144425.name: Mealtime Sabotage
144425.description:
Mealtime Sabotage is a strategic card game where food is your weapon. The goal of the game is to create a complete meal with the fewest calories possible. In addition to the food cards you need to build your meal (entree, 2 sides, dessert and drink), there are sabotage cards which change the value of each food card.

Each player starts the game with 5 cards. On each turn, the active player draws one card and plays one card. Sabotage cards can be played on any place setting, but they cannot stack (one sabotage card per food item). Once your meal is complete, you can play food items on other place settings. The game is finished when all meals are complete. The player with the lowest calorie meal, wins.

144426.name: X-Zine Anduin (Ausgabe 6 - May 2001)
144426.description:
User summary

The final issue of X-Zine Anduin has some Shadowrun content and a generic fantasy adventure, as well as a generic location (Warehouse 23, suitable for mystery, pulp or other genres) and a small spaceship. Some articles (e.g. on infrared vision) round out the issue.

144427.description:
Hold on to your sanity! The Old Ones play Kaosball too!

Kutulu has the following ability:
'At the beginning of your turn, each enemy figure in Kutulu's killzone is knocked down unless its owner burns a live energy card.'

Kutulu is a Kickstarter and convention exclusive Ringer.
144427.name: Kaosball: Ringer – Kutulu
boardgameexpansion: Kaosball: The Fantasy Sport of Total Domination

144428.description:
Les Maréchaux (The Marshals) is an operational wargame designated to simulate campaigns led by French marshals and generals of French Revolution and 1st Empire, when Napoleon was not directly acting on the theater of operations.

The game includes three scenarios:
- "Dupont 1808" related to general Dupont's campaign in south of Spain against spanish general Castaños, during summer 1808.
- "Victor 1811" related to marshal Victor's campaign near Cadix against general La Peña trying to relieve the cit'y siege with help of an english division, late winter 1811.
- "Suchet 1813" related to marshal Suchet's campaign against general Murray for the last big battle in Aragona, spring 1813.

Players are moving divisions and brigades on a "point to point" map. They have to deal with supply, forced march and to prepare battles. The leaders of each army have a key role in coordinating actions.

The game includes:
- one A4 map for Dupont's campaign;
- one A4 map for Victor's campaign;
- one A4 map for Suchet's campaign;
- 108 die-cut counters;
- independent rules and scenarios booklet.

Available with French rules, but English rules can be downloaded from Vae Victis or Designer's website.


The first game in the series is Les Maréchaux: Junot 1808 – Soult 1809 with two campaigns in Portugal.
144428.name: Les Maréchaux II: Dupont 1808 – Victor 1811 – Suchet 1813

144429.description:
It was good and came back to the dark assembly of the pandemonium!
A player is one of the members of the darkness assembly which a bribe and assassination fly about. It is a boom there to get more grants and power by crossing a faction.

This game is an irregularity type draft card game for exclusive use of two. By the turn, I play a hand in the range of an income. A playing place is somewhere in a row that is three before oneself. If cards gather in either row more than five pieces, I can get a faction as a representative with one card of the cards. A score to get changes which card you make a representation. In addition, incomes increase when a faction is completed.

You must hand the card which you were not able to use up during your turn to an opponent at the time of the turn end. While a hand comes and goes like a baton, among each other, a game goes. It is important how it processes the card which does not want to be played by an opponent.
When the factions of oneself or the opponent gathered more than five, the game is finished by the next turn. It is the victory of the player who got more scores. The score adds up the score by the representative of the faction and the score by the income.
144429.name: The Majority 2
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode Twenty-Three: The thick of it

144430.name: Cubetractor
144430.description:
Cubetractor is a neo-retroesque action-strategy-puzzle hybrid where you defeat enemies through an unconventional cube-pulling, turret-building mechanic.

The game carries elements of a reverse tower defense and a grounded bullet-hell dodger to deliver a unique gameplay experience presented in a classic top-down perspective.

You play as Endroi, a menacingly happy-go-lucky quadrubot as he strives to master the art of Cubetracting -- the art of attracting Cubes. It's a deceptively straightforward skill that involves dexterity, acute awareness, multi-tasking and tactical positioning. You'll have to strategize, solve and fight your way through multitudes of enemy installations to achieve your coveted goal.

Source: The Developer Website.

144431.name: The Tower Out of Time
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
144431.description:
From the Publisher's website:

From out of the past comes an ancient evil to plague the present! A mystifying tower crowned by a blinding blood-red light has appeared in the forest, arriving as a never-before-seen comet burns in the sky above. Is its arrival a harbinger of terrible times ahead? Only those heroes brave enough to confront what lurks behind the inexplicable walls of the Pharos of Scales can solve the mystery of the tower’s puzzling arrival!

user comment
Offered as a free PDF on the Goodman Games site for judges participating in the DCC RPG World Tour 2013.

144432.name: deep down
144432.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – VAPORWARE




This game is stuck in the development limbo known as Vaporware. Few to no details have been released about about its gameplay, plot, or release date since its announcement many years ago. It may or may not be in active development, but neither has it been cancelled officially.




Deep Down is a single-player game with the option to have up to four players in co-op multiplayer, akin to that of Dark Souls, with random players dropping into the player's world to help them defeat monsters and find artifacts.

The player perspective for Deep Down begins in New York City in the year 2094. By touching magical artifacts, players are teleported into the distant past to explore dungeons and avoid or battle monsters and seek treasure. Each of these dungeons are randomly generated for each player. As well as this, the artifacts you touch correspond to an emotion, including anger, rage, hate, envy, lust and wrath.

Source: Wikipedia, "Deep Down (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

144433.name: Heroes and Generals
144433.description:
Heroes & Generals is a combined first-person shooter and strategy video game in a World War II setting. It is being developed by independent studio Reto-Moto, which is founded by some of the original founders of IO Interactive and the Hitman series, and will be published by Square Enix.

The developers call it a "mass participation game" in contrast to a traditional massively multiplayer online games, where the actions in the FPS-part of the game reflects into the strategy-part. The player can use weapons from Germany, the United States, and the Soviet Union.

Gameplay
The player starts with a soldier from each faction (United States, Soviet Union, Germany) and can buy additional soldiers with in-game credits. These soldiers are equipped with a default rifle and can play the Encounter game mode immediately. When entering a battle, the player is presented with an interactive map, showing terrain and which team controls which control points. In the Skirmish and Encounter game modes, the player must click on the spawn point of their team (or called faction) and can choose whether to spawn on foot or in a vehicle. In the Assault game mode, the same rules apply, except players can also spawn on control points captured by their team. Teams will always consist of soldiers from the same nation, unlike some World War II games that have teams of mixed nationalities. The game includes World War II era tanks, planes, and land vehicles. Infantry units are also a vital game play aspect. Tactical decisions made by officers in grand campaigns affect in-game support, reinforcements, and logistics. Players will encounter a variety of terrain, from fields and countryside to large cities. The game features three game modes for the FPS-part of the game: Assault, Skirmish and Encounter.

Source: Wikipedia, "Heroes & Generals", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

144434.name: ZigZag
144434.description:
Some cute little people have invaded the land, and when they get together in groups of four they trigger strange symptoms in humans. Apparently, this game is so much fun that you may lose control of your faculties, causing others to chant "Zig! Zag!"

ZigZag is a partnership game (with variants for two and three players) that is played with a deck of 93 cards. Of those cards, 64 show the aforementioned cute little people, and each one of these cards has three characteristics: a person representing one of the four elements, a landscape, and an accessory (sunglasses, a suitcase, etc.)

The goal of the game is to get sets of four cards with a single characteristic (Zig) or two characteristics (Zag) in common. To finish a round, it is necessary to complete a zig, a zag, a double zig, or a zig and a zag. Each combination is allowed only once, and the first partnership to complete all four wins. When a player has completed a set, he must give a pre-arranged signal to his partner, who must then announce what type of set has been completed out loud. If a signal is mistaken, both partners must discard their cards, draw new hands, and play on.

Everyone plays at the same time, exchanging cards with those cards in the center of the table. Beware as the opposing team will do all they can to prevent you from achieving your goal, including using some of the 17 special cards that do things like stop you from collecting a set with a certain characteristic or force an exchange of hands.

In the two- to three-player variant of ZigZag, each player receives one of twelve constraint cards, which limits the types of sets they can collect.

144435.name: Bottlecap Baseball
144435.description: A simulation of Baseball. Bottle caps represent players, one color for each team. The ball is a white bottle cap. By way of flicking a player into the ball with one finger, the ball is; pitched, hit, fielded, thrown to the bases. The playing field is a mat of slick plastic coated paper and has areas marked that indicate different actions of baseball. For instance, if the ball comes to rest in the rectangular area in front of the home plate then a strike is counted against the batter.

144436.name: Back to the Future: The Game
videogameseries: Back to the Future: The Game
videogamecompilation: Back to the Future: The Game - Episode I: It's About Time
Back to the Future: The Game - Episode II: Get Tannen!
Back to the Future: The Game - Episode III: Citizen Brown
Back to the Future: The Game - Episode IV: Double Visions
Back to the Future: The Game - Episode V: OUTATIME
144436.description:
From Wikipedia:
Back to the Future: The Game is an episodic point-and-click adventure role-playing video game based on the Back to the Future film franchise. The game is split up into five episodes. Telltale published the series as retail products for the PlayStation 3 and Nintendo Wii consoles for North America. Deep Silver published the retail Nintendo Wii and PlayStation 3 versions for Europe on May 4, 2012.

Back to the Future: The Game is a point-and-click adventure role-playing video game, played from a third-person perspective. The player controls Marty to explore the 3D environments using either the keyboard, mouse or game controller to move around. The player can have Marty examine objects, talk to non-player characters (initiating dialog through conversation trees), and perform specific actions in order to solve puzzles and progress the game. Some items can be picked up and stored in Marty's inventory, and then can be used later to interact with other characters or objects. The game provides a list of current goals for the player to complete to advance the game. The player can access a hint system, revealing one clue at a time from a number of cryptic clues for how to solve a specific puzzle.

Source: Wikipedia, "Back to the Future: The Game," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

Content Descriptors:
Drug and Alcohol Reference, Language, Mild Blood, Mild Violence, Sexual Themes

Rating Summery:
This is an adventure game based on the Back to the Future movie franchise. Players assume the role of Marty McFly, a teenager who must travel through time to rescue his friend and restore a dystopian version of his hometown. A variety of sequences contain brief instances of violence (e.g., men threatening each other with pistols; a character getting punched in the face; a man being slapped while tied to a chair). One scene depicts a small puddle of blood, though no related violence is shown. Some sequences contain dialogue that is sexual in nature (e.g., “ehaviors that excite your privates should be kept in private,” “They weren't. . . hookers?” and “[L]ook! Girlie mags!”/Boobies?”). In one scene, a magazine stack is identified as “porn.” During the course of the game, the dialogue references alcohol (e.g., “Booze,” “Beer, rum, whiskey, wine coolers, you name it, I drank it,” “. . . drunken bums,” and “Under the influence of alcohol, my mom made a pass at me.”). In one scene, a police officer asks if a character is “on the pot.” The words “sh*t,” “b*tch,” and “a*s” can be heard in dialogue.

Source: ESRB ratings, "ESRB Ratings: Back to the Future: The Game,"

144437.name: Retro/Grade
videogamehonor: 2009 IGF Awards Excellence In Audio Nominee
2009 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Nominee
144437.description:
Retro/Grade is a rhythm game with a unique twist - time is flowing backwards! While it looks like a shoot 'em up in reverse, you must un-fire attacks to the beat of the music while avoiding enemy fire in order to save the space/time continuum.

Source: The Game Website.

144438.name: Sword of Legendia
144438.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




Sword of Legendia was revealed with traiers showing various interviews with developers, one of which was with Makoto Yoshizumi. He was discussing the controller, and he then showed a single piece of artwork. Little was said on the game after this, however, the game remained listed on Namco's Japanese website in their Wii games section.

After the long quiet period, Tsutomu Gouda commented on the game in a 2008 interview regarding the then-upcoming Tales of Vesperia. He confirmed that he was in charge of the game, the game was still in development, that the game would likely undergo a title change before release , as it was not meant to be associated with the Tales series.

On May 19, 2009 in an interview Kentarou Kawashima satated that details of Legendia were unable to be disclosed. In a French interview with Makoto Yoshizumi, it was revealed that Sword of Legendia had been cancelled for several years.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sword of Legendia", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

144439.name: Warrior's Lair
144439.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




Warrior's Lair is an action role-playing game player from an perspective corrected view of an isometric viewpoint, the game-engine includes simulation of destructable environments and ragdoll physics.

A social aspect has been introduced to the game through standard methods including competitive and cooperative play, trading and chat, as well as the integrated ability to post progress on Facebook and Twitter, and by another mechanism whereby players can create and modify their own dungeons (called 'Lairs') where high value items are stored which enhance the player's in game skills, the 'Lairs' as also available to other players as questable locations.

Source: Wikipedia, "Warrior's Lair", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

144440.name: Been There, Done That
144440.description:
From one of the creators of Trivial Pursuit.
Object: move along the coloured rope convincing your opponents that you have BEEN THERE AND DONE THAT. To win players must move in the inner drum and convincing opponents that you have truly BEEN THERE AND DONE THAT.

Roll the die, move your pawn the required number of spaces along your colour of rope (picture on game board), Opponent asks a question from the cards. If you answer no, the next player goes. If you answer yes you must convince they you have been there etc. Players may grill you to see if you are lying. After a vote, if the vote is no, the next player goes, if yes roll again and continue until a no vote or no response.

144442.name: UNO: Jelly Belly Special Edition
144442.description:
From the back of the box:

"UNO teams up with Jelly Belly for this special edition of the fast-paced card game loved by millions. Each game box includes a special deck of bean-shaped UNO cards, Jelly Belly jelly beans and special rules that sweeten the play."

Contents:
54 cards
3.5 oz. Jelly Belly jelly beans (5 flavors)

Compared to a standard Uno deck, there are half as many cards, with only one Wild and one Wild Draw Four but still four zeroes. The rules state that when you force someone to draw cards (with a Draw 2 or wild Draw 4) you can take that many beans from the source pile. If you collect 10 beans, you may immediately discard all cards but one in your hand.

144444.name: Vanitas
144444.description:
VANITAS. A memento mori for your digital hands.
To lift you up when you're feeling down. And drag you down when you're up too high.

Everything flows, nothing remains.
Vanity of vanities, all is vanity!
Life is the farce we are all forced to endure.

Sometimes, when you're depressed, it's good to see something depressing.
A contemplation of the fleetingness of life. To help appreciate what you have.
A meditative experience. A spiritual toy. A reminder of the preciousness of life.

A 3D box filled with intriguing objects. Close the box and open it again to see new objects. You can move the objects by tilting your iPhone or pushing and dragging the objects with your fingers. To create pleasant arrangements that inspire and enchant. Some objects decay. A flower blooms. A bubble pops. Life like an empty dream flits by. Get three of the same and earn a star.

Source: The Publisher Website.

144445.description:
Dicktionary: just a bit naughty, and a whole lot of fun!
An adult version of Pictionary.

Playing Dicktionary may remind you of Charades, but with drawing instead of acting out the answers. In Dicktionary a member draws a clue given from the cards and team players strive to be the first to guess the correct answer. When the answer is not designated "All Play," one team simply tries to come up with the answer before the timer runs out. No drawing talent is required. Dicktionary is adult themed for mature players 18 and up.
144445.name: Dicktionary

144446.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – VAPORWARE




This game is stuck in the development limbo known as Vaporware. Few to no details have been released about about its gameplay, plot, or release date since its announcement many years ago. It may or may not be in active development, but neither has it been cancelled officially.




A young girl gets trapped in a luxurious palace surrounded by a thick forest. Everyone in the palace is asleep. They should have woken up by now. The Prince should have come by now. But the Princess is in no condition to meet him. Assisted by a Wicked Fairy out for revenge, eight unworthy princes have penetrated the forest and disrupted the magic that once protected the sleeping court. The power of the spell is fading. The forest branches are growing. The palace walls are crumbling.

In “8”, there are 8 Fairies who give 8 Talents which get stolen by 8 Princes. This is the backbone of the game's structure which consistes of 8 quests that reward the player with 8 magical abilities. And the Girl's age is around 8.

Source: The Developer Website.

144447.name: Convention: konwentowa gra karciana
144447.description:
"Convention: konwentowa gra karciana" is collective card game. Each player tries to organize manga/anime convention. Players use their card to expand school buildings, prepare events, hire event makers and try to prevent other players to lunch their own conventions.

Released in 2008 at polish MAGNIFIcon convention by manga publishing company Studio JG, game was a parody of polish manga/anime fandom. Many of the cards are based upon real people or situations famous in the polish fandom.

144448.name: TagOn
144448.description:
ABOUT THE GAME

TagOn® is a Bible-based, family-friendly crossword board game that provides instant fun for everyone! You've played crossword games before, but never like this! It enhances your Scriptural knowledge and promotes learning of the Bible. It provides an excellent way for families and friends to have meaningful fun while strengthening their knowledge of God's Word.

TagOn® is a game in which two to four players score points by playing and tagging Bible principal words from individual letter tiles. Words are played across or down in crossword fashion and must appear in a Bible dictionary, Bible Concordance or Bible Research Guide adopted by the players as the game dictionary. The game dictionary may be a hard copy print edition, online edition or mobile phone app. It may also be a searchable online Bible or its corresponding mobile phone app. With your game dictionary, you have set up the stage for fun!

What makes TagOn® unique and interesting? Through suspenseful action and thoughtful play, Bible books, characters, utterances, lands and genealogies of Bible characters as well as events and scenes of Bible times are dramatically revealed. What a game!

OBJECT OF THE GAME

To have fun, learn and to become the person with the most point for playing and tagging Bible words.

THE PLAY

The play of the game involves finding, playing, connecting and tagging related Bible words. Played words may have a direct connection with existing words on the game board. This game is about remembering what Bible words were said, who said them, who were related to those characters, where the words were spoken, and in which Bible book can the words be found.

Players will have opportunities to obtain extra points by playing Bible words that have a direct scriptural relationship with other words [tagging words] or/and by playing words on specific colored squares marked with Bible books, characters, utterances, lands and genealogies on the game board. The revelation of Bible characters, places, events, utterances and genealogies, combined with the tag word challenge makes playing TagOn® a fun and interesting game for the entire family.

What about playing new words by replacing existing letters on the game board? You have to see the game rules and actually play the game. Different Bible stories or events appear in every play of the game. This game is so much fun you’ll want to play until God’s Kingdom comes!

144449.name: The Nazi Occult
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
144449.description:
From the back cover:

In the dark dungeons beneath Nazi Germany, teams of occult experts delved into ancient and forbidden lore, searching for lost secrets of power. This book tells the complete history of the Nazi occult programs, from the quests for the Ark of the Covenant, the Spear of Destiny, and the Holy Grail, to the experiments with lycanthropy and zero-point energy.

144450.name: Rumble Pie
144450.description:
Rumble Pie is the blazingly fast, incredibly fun card game that keeps everyone in the middle of the action from start to finish. Players slap down cards quickly to build piles, land a pie and ... KaPow!... earn their team a point!

Piece of cake, right? Not when cards are flying in from every direction — any player can attack or defend on any other player's board at any time. Teams that work together, act fast and watch each other's back will surely have an edge when the pies start to fly.

144451.description:
There’s a difference between need and want, and you will want the nine-pound mountain of content contained in the Master Set. The Master Set is an extension of the Basic Set, so you will need the Basic Set to play.

Master Set key content includes:
-- 21 Map Platters
-- 12 Dome Keys
-- 144 Characters
-- 302 Treasures
-- 48 Henchmen
-- 88 Labyrinth Guardians
-- 2 Team Marker Sets
-- 1 Challenge Deck

Microbadges

- Duel of Ages II Fan - Amaze
- Duel of Ages II fan - The Full Degree
144451.name: Duel of Ages II: Master Set

144452.name: Duel of Ages II: Collector's Bundle
144452.description:
To ensure perfection, Worldspanner conducted a test manufacturing run on maps and keys. This test package is known as the Collector's Bundle which contains:

-- Four unique maps not found in the Basic or Master set (Oracle, Boggy Hollow, Grand Tunnel, and Crags)
-- Second set of Team Bases and Lith's Lair
-- Three blank keys
-- Numerous blank markers

Microbadges

- Duel of Ages II Fan - Amaze
- Duel of Ages II fan - The Full Degree

144453.name: Fantail Faustball
144453.description:
Fantail Faustball is another board game of the Fantail sportys games line. It is an educational, entertaining board game, where two teams play Faustballby using smart charts each.
Faustball is played on a large field. The net is located at a certain height from the floor. Players must hit the ball with the fist; it is allowed to let the ball bounce on the floor one time before hiting it. Up to three passes are allowed before the ball is returned to the opposite field.

On the game board there is only a piece (the ball) which is moved by each team in turn, which makes the gameplay very agile.

144454.name: Zoo Fu: Path of the Samurai Zookeeper
144454.description:
Players will control their furry, scaly, and feathered combatants in an uproarious spin on competitive matching games.

Assemble your attack combos from the cards in your hand, then choose an opponent. Fling down your attack with enthusiasm and determination, calling out your moves with energy and style! "I attack you with the Spinning Money Punch!" Your opponent looks unimpressed until you throw down your finishing move card, "Of Doooooooom!!!" His face goes white and sweat beads on his brow as he reaches into his cards and…

Will your attack be successful and earn you powerful chi? Will your opponent block your attack, taking your chi and causing you to lose standing in the eyes of the Samurai Zookeeper? Perhaps you need more training in the Zookeeper's dojo! Never fear, though, play continues until the deck is exhausted, so there's plenty of time to hone your skills and change your destiny in this game of skill, luck, and bravado for 3-6 players.

144455.description:
Two player expansion to Age of Steam released as part of the 2013 Essen Set of Winsome games.

Consists of 1 map (11x17) and one rule sheet.
144455.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Belgium

144457.name: Zoombies: Animales de la Muerte!
144457.description:
The zoo animals have come down with a serious case of Undeath! Now it’s up to a group of rowdy kids, fresh off the school bus, to stop these Zoombies from escaping and infecting the rest of the world! Armed with Hatchets, Machine Guns, Bear Traps and other assorted deadly goodies, the kids are ready to chop those pesky Zoombies into meaty morsels!

Source: The Publisher Website.

144458.description:
Battle at Świecino was one of the most important and decisive battles of Thirteen Years' War, conflict that was fought in 1454–66 between the Prussian Confederation, allied with the Kingdom of Poland and the State of the Teutonic Order. It was first major victory of the polish forces.

Game allows players to play whole battle. It also contains a variant that adds army of the prince Eric of Pomerania as the Teutonic Order ally.

"Świecino 1462" is a first mini game created for the "Medieval" wargames system and uses same rules, prepared for the games based in medieval times. Game was added to the 16'th issue of "Taktyka and Strategia" magazine.
144458.name: Świecino 1462

144459.name: Pronunciation Guide
144459.description:
User Summary:

A Guide to help with the pronunciation of the words specific to the world of Tri-Kazel.

144460.name: Cycling Party
144460.description:
Cycling Party is a game for 2 to 6 players, which reflects the essential features of road cycling. Each player will select a cycling team and take responsibility for managing the movements of 5-6 riders in their team. The aim of each team will be to secure victory at the end of each stage or in the general classification.

The course is built from hexagonal tiles. Each hexagon tile is divided in turn into three spaces, with each space representing a kilometre of the race. Mountain sections, intermediate sprints and the finish line are shown using indicator tokens placed at the kilometre points agreed upon by the players at the beginning of the race.

This game comes in three versions: Junior, Senior and Master. Each version builds on the rules of previous versions. In the Junior version each rider is moved by rolling two six-sided dice. Riders in a peloton (at least five riders in the same space) may choose not to roll and instead move five spaces. A rider in the peloton may choose to roll in the hope of raising its pace or of breaking away (roll of 10-12). The difficulty of the mountain sections is represented by rolling just one dice. Each team has five water bottles that can be spent to move a rider an extra space (cost of one bottle on the flat, 2 bottles in mountains). The rider furthest across the finish line at the end of a turn is the winner.

The Senior version introduces different categories of climb and gives each team member a role (climber, sprinter, rouleur, domestique (flat or mountain), and lantern rouge). Each role has particular abilities. Each team may launch one attack by rolling four dice instead of the normal two. Falls, fast descents and falling back to join a team-mate are also represented.

The Master version makes use of software accessed through the publisher’s website to enable whole tours to be run.

144461.name: Kvaredroj
144461.description:
A 2 players abstract game that uses a bunch of d4.
The goal is to capture the opponent's 4 target dice.
The dice can move as many times as shown on their current position but one can chose to use one turn to change the value on one die instead of moving.
Any captured non-target die is rerolled and replaced on the board, so placement and adjusting values is often a better option than attacking the opponent's dice.

144462.description:
Ĝaberŭoko (Jabberwock) is a trick taking card game with an Alice in Wonderlands theme where players must fulfill different contracts (20 available), sometimes trying to take some specific cards, sometimes avoiding them.
The game contains standard Ace->10 cards and three different Jabberwocks in each color. The Jabberwock is a trump card that comes back in the hand of a player and immediately evoluate to a less powerful version of himself. Only another Jabberwock can beat him.
Because it's not good to have Jabberwocks in your hand at the end of the game, you'll have to find the right balance between taking cards with the trump and trying to weaken it to give it to someone else.
144462.name: Ĝaberŭoko

144464.description:
Contains "Werwölfe", "Werwölfe: Artefakte", "Werwölfe: Klassische Filmmonster" and "Werwölfe: Kreaturen der Nacht".
172 Cards, notepad, pencil and two rulebooks.
144464.name: Werwölfe Deluxe

144466.name: Wizard Ops Tactics
144466.description:
Are you ready to command a crazy commando team known as the Wizard Ops?

Prepare to Battle your friends and the rest of the world!

Wizard Ops Tactics is an asynchronous, turn based, tactical game that allows you to battle your friends whenever and wherever you like!

Source: The Game Website.

144467.name: Eight-Year Resistance War
144467.description:
Eight Year Resistance War is a solitaire strategy game covering the Second Sino-Japanese War (July 7, 1937 – September 2, 1945), which was a military conflict fought primarily between the Republic of China and the Empire of Japan from 1937 to 1941. After the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor in 1941, the war merged into the greater conflict of World War II as a major front of what is broadly known as the Pacific War. The Second Sino-Japanese War was the largest Asian war in the 20th century. It also made up more than 50% of the casualties in the Pacific War if the 1937–1941 period is taken into account. Although the two countries had fought intermittently since 1931, total war started in earnest in 1937 and ended only with the surrender of Japan in 1945.

In this game, you, the player, lead China’s Army (KMT Central Army) to fight against Japanese invasion. Major battles and historical events are represented by event cards which may be executed chronologically as the history (see the Historical Game option in 17.0), or randomly so as to make youself unprepared for what will happen in the next turn. You have to use your limited resources (limited number of actions, and event cards beneficial to you) to avoid Japanese capture of your Capital, Chungking. To do so, you need to gain support from Western Allies and the help from your unreliable temporary ally – Chinese Communist Party’s Red Army, which will get the final victory (China) from you if you allow them to expand and gain sufficient political support among generals, soldiers and civilians.

Errata: Page 9, [15.1] "i)..." -> "the KMTPS level <=20."
Map file Page 3，step 2: Only the first "2".

(You are always welcome for any comments or suggestions.)

144468.description:
Normally, calm reigns supreme amongst the animals of the jungle, but when the time comes to eat, the animals gather round the forest of totems and their wild instincts take over. The hungriest animals race to catch their prey first. Others become angry and shout, while the chameleon hides. When the hunter appears, there is panic as the animals race to protect themselves!

Jungle Speed Safari is a standalone game that's part of the Jungle Speed family. The core gameplay is the same, with players turning over cards from their personal stacks one by one in front of themselves and reacting when certain cards or combinations of cards appear, but Jungle Speed Safari features five wooden totems to grab instead of one, and you interact with them in different ways, with every card that's revealed possibly triggering an action. If a player reveals a hungry animal card, for example, all players must race to grab the appropriate totem to satisfy the animal. Whoever grabs that totem adds the hungry animal card to his score pile.
144468.name: Jungle Speed Safari
boardgameexpansion: Jungle Speed Safari: Hyena Promo Card

144469.description:
This is a promotional item for the The Duke core game, adding a strong defensive unit.

This promotional release was given to those who supported the Kickstarter campaign in 2012, as a fun tongue-in-cheek way to apologize for the extra delays in manufacturing the game by having the Shieldmaiden guard them from backer attacks.

Includes:
1 x Shieldmaiden Light Stained Tile
1 x Shieldmaiden Dark Stained Tile
144469.name: The Duke: Shieldmaiden Promo Tile

144470.name: Regionalia Cthuliana - Mexiko
144470.description:
(user summary)
This is a reedition from the Cthuloide Welten magazine.
It contains the description of Mexico in the 1920s, and the scenario "Bittere Wasser".

144471.name: CLASH! Dawn of Steam
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game of Crowd Funding Jared Barry Interview 04-17-2014
144471.description:
CLASH! Dawn of Steam is an asymmetric strategy card game where one player will fight to destroy a Setting while the other stands up to protect it.
Each turn, both players will gather resources, and then use those resources to play powerful cards from their hands.

144472.description:
From the publisher's website:

The selections of some of the “decisive battles” have sparked conversations over the years. Vicksburg over Gettysburg? The Metarus over Zama? Syracuse?

No one has ever questioned the selection of Midway as the decisive battle of the Pacific War. All agree that this one changed everything, as the Japanese plan to “lure” the remaining US fleet to its destruction led to a strategic defeat, due to code breaking, heroism, and remarkable timing.

Now you can play out this exciting battle and see if you can do better. The Battle of Midway, June 3-6, 1942 gives you all the parts you need to gain insight into the questions facing both sides. Paul Rohrbaugh’s design blends clean simplicity with a fine level of detail (even accounting for the Japanese planes intended to be assembled and used on the captured island!). It includes an overview map-board of the area, an off-map battle board, and a variant map with Midway in detail, where, for the first time, you can pursue the actual Japanese invasion of the island and see what might have been.

Rules cover battles in the air, planes versus ships and versus land, surface to surface, submarines, seaplanes, and more, all in rules designed to be fast, combined with challenges that encourage replay.

You know the history.

Now, see if you can change it.
Part of the TPS "Decisive Battles" series

That means straightforward rules, key insights into the history behind the game, and designs aimed at one-session conclusions and high replay value."

The Battle of Midway 1942 AD includes:
• One 11” by 17” map (containing the Game Map and Battle Board)
• Two Naval/Air Unit Deployment Charts ( Japanese and US)
• 176 counters
• This set of rules
• Four six-sided (D6) dice
• Two 8.5” by 11” inserts (map and rules for the optional variant game)
144472.name: The Battle of Midway 1942 AD
boardgameexpansion: The Battle of Midway 1942 AD: Independence Day

144474.name: Le Vol de l'Aigle III
144474.description:
Le Vol de l'Aigle III (The Flight of the Eagle III) is a wargame that recreates some of the most famous Napleonic campaigns.

The system is a double-blinded system that uses an Umpire. Players can communicate only through written messages. It uses maps of that time and a simple system to manage units. Combats are solved using a face to face system, simple but precise, with the morale as the main endpoint. Combats can also be solved using any existing operational or tactical system including miniatures.

The present volume 3 does not need the volume 1 or 2 to be played. It includes four booklets (three are over 60 pages) including all the rules of volume 1 and 2, a new edition of the tactical rules The Eagle Fights, 50 pages of data to transfer all the armies of the time between both systems, the special rules of the ten campaigns included: Bavaria and Austria 1809, France 1814 and the eight Peninsula campaigns in Spain and Portugal (around one a year between 1808 and 1814). Seven maps and 52 units sheets are included.

Cherry on the cake, an experimental recruitment module is also presented, with a strategic map, two pages of units, and rules managing every parameter involved in the Administration of War.

The game is available in French and in English.

144475.name: Disco Dan
videogameversion: English/European ZX Spectrum (Sinclair Research re-release) Cassette edition
144475.description:
From the inlay:

Can poor Dan decontaminate the atomic fuel rods in time? In this new 3D machine code game, you control Dan Dan The Atomiser man, jumping from disc to disc, trying to reduce the ever increasing radiation levels in an atomic pile.

However Up 'n' Atom 'Arry and his gang of vagrant particles are thirsting for the energy in your back pack, which makes life a bit awkward at times. The there's Ron the Rapacious Robot, not the sort to meeting a dark alley (or anywhere else for that matter)!!

User Summary

Disco Dan consists of two stages. The first stage consists of running down a tunnel to reach the reactor. The player must avoid enemies and pits.

The reactor stage is slightly reminiscent of Q*Bert in that you are jumping diagonally between various platforms with an aim to change their colour, while avoiding enemies. The difference is that each platform has a number, which is steadily increasing. Jumping on a platform reduces the number. If a disk is reduced to 0 (green) then it is safe and will no longer increase unless a neighbour explodes or Ron the Robot steps on it. If any of the discs reach the maximum number, they start to flash. If the player doesn't reach it in time it will explode and will then be shown with no number on it. Ron can be shot to remove him from the board for a time. Other roaming enemies (Atoms) can only be moved off one disc onto another.

Dan has limited energy, which is used every time he moves, fires or touches an enemy. It also steadily decreases over time, representing the power to his Life Support.

Turning all the discs green awards an extra life, but allowing all to explode results in game over.

Credits:

Coding and Design by Daren White & John Line
Tea & sympathy - Sandie & Brenda

144476.name: Kingdom Rush Frontiers
144476.description:
User Summary

Kingdom Rush Frontiers is the sequel to 2011's Kingdom Rush. In Kingdom Rush Frontiers, the player places towers in pre-determined spots on each level to defeat waves of enemies. Towers can be upgraded, and the final upgrade of each tower type gives the player a choice of two different special towers, each with its own abilities.

Although very similar to Kingdom Rush, Frontiers offers new types of enemies and 8 completely new special towers, plus the ability to use and upgrade heroes.

144477.name: Dance Dance Revolution KONAMIX
144477.description:
Back of CD Case

THE REVOLUTION CONTINUES...

The hottest dancing craze continues with a brand new sequel to Dance Dance Revolution. Straight from the arcades, step into the spotlight and put your skills to the test as you move to the groove. Get ready to dance the night away with all-new songs and game modes. Let the pulsating music and colorful graphics excite your senses while you get your dancin' fix with Dance Dance Revolution KONAMIX.

144478.name: Grange Hill
videogameversion: English/European ZX Spectrum (Bug-Byte re-release) Cassette edition
144478.description:
User Summary

'Cha-now chow-chow!'

Guide Gonch and Hollo on their quest to recover a confiscated Walkman from the titular London comprehensive school, after hours. In line with Grange Hill's anti-drug message of the mid-Eighties, one of the first encounters involved a heroin pusher. Accepting his offer of a packet of white powder results in an early death, and one of the more darker moments of videogame history. Just say no!

boardgameintegration: Guerra de Mitos VI: Portals activated
Guerra de Mitos VI: Portals activated
144479.description:
Myths at War, first published as Guerra de Mitos, is a card game set in a fantastic world where different mythologies coexist. It is a different, dynamic game designed to be able to build different decks with very distinct and varied strategies, and each expansion increases both the number of available mythologies and the game possibilities.

This first installment of Myths at War contains 300 cards split between the Nordic, Egyptian and Japanese mythologies (GDMI+GDM3 spanish editions). Each mythology includes two pantheons (cards that define your game strategy) + cards for the gods deck (which includes characters, events and resources) + cards for the designs deck (actions, equipment and summonings).

Each player in Myths at War needs to build his own deck of at least 51 cards (1 pantheon / 20 gods / 30 designs) of his choice, and each expansion increases the diversity of characters, actions and strategies you can use in order to achieve victory but all expansions can be played on his own.

During the game, each player has to bring into play the cards his oracles offer him and play actions from the designs deck both in the influence phase (where the gods plan from their pantheon) and in the confrontation phase (where the characters who decide to go to battle fight to decrease the opponent’s power) to obtain supremacy or consign the opponent to oblivion.
144479.name: Myths at War (Nordic, Egyptian and Japanese)
boardgameaccessory: Guerra de mitos: Marcador de jugador inicial
boardgamepodcastepisode: ET78: Fin de temporada... en el ESPACIOOOOOO
RJ36: 2 hores al 3r CorreJocs
RJ41: Cinc cèntims de DAU Barcelona 2014
RJ48: Com es crea un LCG amb "Pak" Gallego

144480.name: Finding Haven
144480.description:
Author's description from the text:

Finding Haven is a game about dissidents rebelling against or seeking escape from an alien force of corporate totalitarianism. And about human nature. There is that.

In Finding Haven, there’s at least three general kinds of situations you can choose to play in:

(1) Discovery: your characters all begin play as naïve citizens, believing in the worldview spread by Demosian propaganda, but you discover the horrifying truth in the first session or two. You might be taking winners of the Culling to meet a Starliner around Europa station, or supplies to and from Io. Something goes wrong, and someone winds up seeing something they shouldn't. DE finds out something is off, and a patrol ship goes to investigate.

(2) Escape and Pursuit: your characters know the awful truth: the Demosians do send the winners of the Culling off to Jupiter, but there are no starliners taking them to Wonderland: they are used as incubation chambers for Demosian eggs. When the larvae hatch, they slowly eat their way out of the paralyzed hosts. Those culled on the other hand are used as fresh meat for adult Demosians, and occasionally recycled as cheap meat for human fast food restaurants a la soylent green. You’ve heard of something called Haven on pirate broadcasts, a place safe from the aliens, and you’ve stolen or hijacked a ship and are trying to find it. The Demosian Enforcers of course are trying to find you.

(3) Rebellion: In an Earth-based game, the PCs can be fighting a rebel war, probably mostly covert, against the Demosians. Goals will include both striking against Demosian targets and trying to get their message out to the general population.

User comment
Finding Haven was runner-up in the English part of Game Chef 2013: Icons.

144481.name: Beach Buggy Simulator
144481.description:
From the inlay:

You've just bought yourself a shiny new beach buggy and entered the Dune Trials to show everyone how excellent it is. Burn across the sand hills, jump over the rocks and fire, and if you have to, shoot out the helicopters. Beat the clock and qualify for the next, harder, round.

User Summary

In Beach Buggy Simulator, the player views an undulating course from side-on. The Buggy drives from left to right. The course is strewn with boulders and fires. The player must jump this obstacles otherwise the Buggy will explode. Also hindering progress are helicopters which can be shot at or avoided.

A bar at the bottom left shows progress through the level, which must be completed before the timer runs out. The player does not have limited lives, but the obstacles slow down progress and cost the player fuel. If the fuel runs out, the speed of the Buggy is reduced to a crawl. Fuel can be replenished by driving over fuel dumps scattered through the level.

144482.name: Frakkin' Epic
144482.description:
publisher blurb

Many geeks known of Beau M. K. Prichard for his behind-the-scenes involvement in Zombie Orpheus Entertainment series like JourneyQuest and Rude Mechanical. He's also a producer on the super nerdy web series Glitch. On the way back from the Fandemonium con in Idaho, Jesse Lee Keeter (star of Glitch and JourneyQuest) asked if there was a way to play D&D in the backseat. Beau came up with what eventually developed into Frakkin' Epic, the simple, fast-paced, perfect-for-roadtrips, RPG system. This is a game that rewards creativity, encourages shenanigans, and makes table top gaming, fast, accessible, and fun for practically everyone.

144483.name: Classic Trainer
144483.description:
From the inlay:

As the owner of a stable of horses, it is your ambition to train one or more of your stable to win the greatest 14 furlong race in the calendar. To achieve this you must deduce the horses' ideal racing distance, and by a combination of training and racing, increase their class and fitness to a degree which will enable them to win the ultimate race of the season - the Derby.

Credits:

Written by Steve Bye

144484.name: Classic Trainer II
144484.description:
From the inlay:

The follow-up to our first release, Classic Trainer, Trainer II takes all the best features and improves on them, resulting in a highly playable stable management simulation.

The object of the game is to build a stable of horses to maximum class and fitness; along the way, this will involve winning as many races as possible, in order to collect prize money with which you can consolidate and improve your position, by training and buying new horses.

Credits:

Written by Steve Bye
Produced by Bernard Gernard

144485.description:
Contains Sellsword miniature and matching card

Available as an exclusive add-on during the Kickstarter campaign
144485.name: Xia: Legends of a Drift System – Sellsword
boardgameexpansion: Xia: Legends of a Drift System

144486.description:
You take the role of an irritable cowboy, slinging insults from a deck of cards in front of you in order to be the last man standing.

The game uses a starting word and a deck of second and final words distributed amongst all players. Everyone takes it in turns to say the first word, then all the words on the cards in the middle pile, then the top card from their hand (which is added to the pile) followed by the final word. If you cannot remember the entire phrase you take all the cards in the middle pile as one "hit". When you take your third "hit" you are out of the game.

Hats are not required but cowboy voices are mandatory.
144486.name: Them's Fightin' Words!

144488.name: Evil Baby Orphanage: Crayon Manifesto
144488.description:
10 Time Nanny Cards
5 Toy Cards
20 Action Cards
15 New Unique Babies
1 Time Machine Card

Requires base game to play.

The Crayon Manifesto is a supplement to the Evil Baby Orphanage card game. It introduces Time Nanny cards which give players alternate win conditions or special abilities, adding a whole new layer to the game! Be careful, there are also fifteen brand new toddlers to terrorize your orphanage.

144489.name: Evil Baby Orphanage: Nerdfighteria Expansion
144489.description:
John and Hank Time Nannies
5 Toys
20 Action Cards
6 Unique evil babies

The Nerdfighteria expansion is a supplement to the Evil Baby Orphanage card game. It lets you and your friends run your orphanages in true Nerdfighter fashion. Prevent your babies from being bullied with the nerdfighter gang sign, or unleash the giant squid of anger. But whatever happens, keep calm and don't forget to be awesome!

144490.name: The Tome of Tridlins
144490.description: This is a major expansion for the game Nuclear Renaissance. It adds a full campaign system, along with hundreds of options for building gangs. It includes full rules for new gangs including mutants, beasts, zombies, robots, military forces, hover boarders, flying vehicles, boring machines and much more.

144491.description:
“Yes, yes, Kaosball – to the death. But can we not be gentlemen about it?” -The Surgeon, coach

Elegant and poised gadgeteers hailing from New Victoria, the Klockwerks bring their unique brand of weaponized sportsmanship to Kaosball. Their explosive tactics on the field are highly advanced, with the ability to knock enemies right down the scoreboard – with possibly disastrous side effects!
144491.name: Kaosball: Team – New Victoria Klockwerks
boardgameexpansion: Kaosball: The Fantasy Sport of Total Domination

144492.description:
New York, 1842: The docks along South Street bustle with activity. Packet ships are constantly arriving and departing. There are so many packet ships waiting along the docks that the area has become known as the "Packet Row".

In the game Packet Row, each player represents a trading company that's trying to make as much profit as possible on the trans-Atlantic trade. However, having a lot of cash is not enough to win this game. You must spend your money for the benefit of the city at the right time to gain as many victory points as possible.
144492.name: Packet Row
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 14.1 - Essen Spiel 2013 Special
Packet Row (Pegasus): Spiele-Podcast Nr. 214
The Game Pit: Episode 15.2 - Council Chamber Essen Review

144493.description:
This scenario shows the Bretons fighting the Vikings out of their country.
Alain le Grand (Alain the Great) allies with Judicael then confronts the Vikings from the South of Brittany. At first, Judicael is beaten and killed but Alain makes a strong stand near Questembert and slaughters the Vikings.
He becomes the sole ruler of Brittany for the next 17 years.

The scenario also adds 1 new map & 9 new counters for the original game Les Rois Francs.

Ownership of Les Rois Francs is needed to play this scenario.
144493.name: Questembert 890

144494.description:
“Stealth is a tool, but foreknowledge is a weapon.” -Coach Orodoki

You might see them coming, but your sudden knockdown or even death … that’s something the Ninjas foresaw a long time ago. Cloaked in the haze of their native Shadowvale, these death-dealers wait patiently for their opponents expose their weakness, then they strike true and final. Surprise!
144494.name: Kaosball: Team – Shadowvale Ninjas
boardgameexpansion: Kaosball: The Fantasy Sport of Total Domination

144495.description:
In 5150 - Fighter Command you can command a flight of combat spacecraft fighters. You're the eyes and ears of the fleet and lives depend on you doing your job. Your job is simple: sweep the stars of the enemy. For you it's not who the enemies are but where they are. Your missions will range from patrolling in front of the fleet, to attacking the enemy when you find them, to defending the fleet. You'll be fighting a variety of Races and Factions who want nothing more than to take you out. In 5150 - Fighter Command you'll find:

Rules for squadron level fighter and spaceship combat. Dynamic mission, combat and dogfighting rules let you play head-to-head, co-op and solo. Take the helm as any of the primary Factions and Races in the 5150 Universe. Pre-generated scenarios and missions for quick-start battles. Complete campaign rules let you run your Fighter pilot or Ship's captain through an entire story line.

5150 - Fighter Command can be played solo, same side with everyone against the game, and of course head-to-head against your friends. Playable with any ship models, in any scale, this easy to learn yet tough to master game is perfect for the casual or battle hardened space gamer.
144495.name: 5150: Fighter Command

144496.description:
"Arigatogozaimashita"

Is he an experiment to create the ultimate human Kaosball player? Perhaps an avatar of grace from Shadowvale? Maybe just a phenomenal athlete, drawn to the sport and specialized in ball handling? Regardless of which origin story you believe, one thing is indisputable: he really is awesome.
144496.name: Kaosball: Ringer – Mr. Awesome
boardgameexpansion: Kaosball: The Fantasy Sport of Total Domination

144497.name: ÜNE
144497.description:
From the Introduction:

The role of a game master ("GM") running a tabletop roleplaying game can be a tough one. Not only do they have to maintain a handle on the stage they are setting, but they also have to keep things interesting. A lot of times a GM will look towards a pre-made adventure - many of which require players to do A then B then C to get D, etc. - to save some time in the game preparation. Just as many times, players will start at A then send their characters to X, destroy C, and then run away from D to get to M. All the GM's planning in the world cannot account for every action the players want their characters to take.

Perhaps the worst situation in which a GM can find himself results when a player character ("PC") is trying to have an unforseen conversation with a non-player character ("NPC"). For example, the Mayor that Dooley wants to meet. The GM could just ignore the player's request and say that the Mayor says nothing interesting. Another GM could use the Mayor to get the PC's back on track with the prepared adventure. A GM could take a break to flesh out the area the PC's want to explore.

This supplement attempts to help a GM create interesting NPC's on the fly so that if the third option is taken, the task is simpler and the results fun. Instead of just a stereotypical Mayor (whatever that may be), with a few die rolls a Mayor can be created with a history, motivations, and even a reason to speak with the PC's. The best part is that this supplement is universal. It was designed to work for every genre from fantasy to horror, space opera to post-apocalypse adventure.

144498.description:
The balance of power is shifting among the Order Of The Gods!


The goddess Freya can permanently increase the value of the other beings.
The resourceful Dwarf taps the power of neighboring gods.
The monstrous Niohoggr hoards extra benefits for anyone brave enough to defeat it.
And the swift flying Raven can score twice in the same turn!


Play these new tiles with the Völuspá base game, or blend tiles from the Order of the Gods expansion with tiles from the Saga of Edda expansion. Four recommended game set-up variants are included, and many other variants are possible, enabling you to enjoy Völuspá and these expansions in many different ways. The possibilities in Völuspá are more endless than ever!
144498.name: Völuspá: Order of the Gods
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 15: Voluspa and Tash-Kalar
Episode 77 Origins preview, Buonocore drops by, and Xmen chat (spoilers)
The Seventh Peg Ep. 2- Stronghold Games

144499.description:
A pasha (a.k.a., padisha) is a powerful governor. In Pasha, all players try to roll the best combination with five dice to become a Pasha and capture the most valuable card. Those who use their action cubes smartly will have good chances to win the game.

Play a card to determine the points that can be scored this round.

Roll the dice and try to make the best combination.

Claim the most valuable card and win bonus tiles to get special actions.
144499.name: Pasha

144500.name: Hidden in Plain Sight
144500.description:
Imagine a race where every runner has a gun with one bullet. Do you sprint to the finish? Or hang back in the safety of the crowd? Death Race is one of five game modes which challenge players to blend in with NPCs to accomplish goals while risking elimination by their opponents. Hidden in Plain Sight is a local-multiplayer game for 2-4 players (and unlimited spectators!)

Source: The Developer Website.
